tormina: <entryFree id="n48565" type="main" key="tormi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tormĭna</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n48565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">tormĭnes</orth>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 32, 11</bibl>) [torqueo], <hi rend="ital">a griping of the bowels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the gripes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48565.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: proxima his, inter intestinorum mala, tormina esse consueverunt: <foreign lang="greek">dusenteri/a</foreign> Graece vocatur, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">157, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:19:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 19, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 72, § 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:74" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 47, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:103 al" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 5, 33, § 103 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n48565.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormina urinae,</quote> <trans><tr>strangury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 8, 30, § 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:144" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 15, 50, § 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
torminalis: <entryFree id="n48566" type="main" key="tormi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tormĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tormina</etym>, <sense id="n48566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the gripes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good against the colic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 30 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 21, 23, § 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
torminosus: <entryFree id="n48567" type="main" key="tormi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tormĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subject to the gripes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">colic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:12:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 12, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tornatilis: <entryFree id="n48568" type="main" key="torna_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tornātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>torno</etym>, <sense id="n48568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">turned in a lathe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm. 17, 19.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">finished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautifully wrought</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tornator: <entryFree id="n48569" type="hapax" key="torna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tornātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turner</hi>, Firm. Math. 4, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tornatura: <entryFree id="n48570" type="main" key="torna_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tornātūra</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">turning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turnery</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 6, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
torno: <entryFree id="n48571" type="main" key="torno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tornus</etym>, <sense id="n48571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> in a lathe, <hi rend="ital">to round off.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48571.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. rotundo): idque ita tornavit (deus), ut nihil effici possit rotundius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaeram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 93, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis qui tornatur in vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 22, 44, § 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbines columnarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48571.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smooth</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">male tornati versus, Hor.A.P. 441: barbam,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>to stroke</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 50, 2</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">P. a. comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tornatioris eloquii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Catechiz. 8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Catechiz. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tornus: <entryFree id="n48572" type="greek" key="tornus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tornus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">to/rnos,</foreign> <sense id="n48572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a turner</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s wheel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lathe.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48572.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit quasi ut ad tornum saxorum structa tuamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 361</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:205" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 40, 76, § 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tiliae leves torno Non formam accipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 449</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:38 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 3, 38 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n48572.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: angusto versus includere torno. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34:43" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34, 43</bibl>; Auct. Paneg. ad Pis. 83.</sense></entryFree>
torone: <entryFree id="n48573" type="main" key="To^ro_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏrōnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*torw/nh,</foreign> <sense id="n48573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Chalcidice in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:100" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 31, 51, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 30, 4</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Toronae promontorium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:45:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 45, 15</bibl>. — Hence. </sense><sense id="n48573.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏrō-naeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belenging to Torone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Toronæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <trans><tr>the mod. Gulf of Kassandhra</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏrōnaei</orth>, ōrum. <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Torone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 35</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48573.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tŏrō-năĭcus</orth>, a. um. <hi rend="ital">adj., of Torone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Toronæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 11</bibl></cit>. <cb n="TORP" /></sense></entryFree>
torosulus: <entryFree id="n48574" type="main" key="to^ro_su^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏrōsŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n48574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [torosus], <hi rend="ital">muscular</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 117, 8</bibl></cit>; id. ap. Jovin. 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
torosus: <entryFree id="n48575" type="main" key="to^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>torus</etym>, <sense id="n48575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of muscle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">muscular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brawny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fleshy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lusty.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48575.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tauris torosior cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:86" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 86</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48575.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba hirsutior torosiore caule,</quote> <trans><tr>more fleshy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 53, § 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:91" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 5, 29, § 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clava,</quote> <trans><tr>knotty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:2:79" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 2, 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
torpedo: <entryFree id="n48576" type="main" key="torpe_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torpēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>torpeo</etym>, <sense id="n48576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stiffness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">numbness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflexibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggishness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torpidity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48576.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare; not in Cic. or Cæs.; syn. torpor): inertia atque torpedo plus detrimenti facit quam exercitio, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupavit nescio qua vos torpedo, qua non gloria movemini neque flagitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:61:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 61, 26</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">si tanta torpedo animos obrepsit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 1:48:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 48, 19</bibl></cit> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta torpedo invaserat animum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48576.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the torpedo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crampfish</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">electric ray</hi>: Raia torpedo, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=77" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 77</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 50, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 42, 67, § 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 1, 2, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
torpefacio: <entryFree id="n48577" type="hapax" key="torpe^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torpĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, făcĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>torpeofacio</etym>, <sense id="n48577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to benumb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make torpid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">torporavit pro torpefecit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 182, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
torpeo: <entryFree id="n48578" type="main" key="torpe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torpĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root tarp-, to sate; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/rpw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n48578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be stiff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">numb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">motionless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torpid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>, etc. (syn.: langueo, languesco, stupeo, rigeo). </sense><sense id="n48578.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpentes gelu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:56:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 56, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:55:8" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 55, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">digitus torpens frigore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">languidi et torpentes oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpentes rigore nervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:58:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 58, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra torpent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 50, 51, § 168</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">torpentes membrorum partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 4, 7, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpent infractae ad proelia vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 499</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duroque simillima saxo Torpet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid vetat et nervos magicas torpere per artes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes torpentes inveniantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 92, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem habes aegre torpentia membra trahentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:68" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non eadem vini atque cibi torpente palato Gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:203" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 203</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non exacuet torpens sapor ille palatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:10:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 10, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48578.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. things, <hi rend="ital">to be still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">motionless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpentes lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:452" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus depressus hieme pruinis torpet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orpheus tacuit torpente lyrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 348" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra Musarum longo torpentia somno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2</bibl></cit>, praef. 51; 1, 262.—</sense><sense id="n48578.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be stupid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupefied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">astounded; to be dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">listless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi> (cf. stupeo): <cit><quote lang="la">timeo, totus torpeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 179</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">timore torpeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpentibus metu qui aderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 29, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum volumus cessatione torpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 37, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidnam torpentes subito obstupuistis Achivi? id. poët. Div. 2, 30, 64: torpentes metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 29, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defixis oculis animoque et corpore torpet?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Pausiacā torpes tabellā,</quote> <trans><tr>when you are lost in admiration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 7, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec torpere gravi passus sua regna veterno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigere ac torpere senis consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 23, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia re subitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpebat vox spiritusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrii desperatione torpebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus ad spem et fiduciam erigere torpentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:13" default="NO">4, 14, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
torpesco: <entryFree id="n48579" type="main" key="torpesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torpesco</orth>, <itype>pŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n48579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [torpeo], <hi rend="ital">to grow stiff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">numb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become useless</hi> or <hi rend="ital">torpid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48579.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars corporis torpescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 89, § 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elaeomeli qui bibere, torpescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 4, 50, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scorpiones visā lychnide torpescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 26, 98, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpuerat gelido lingua retenta metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpuerant molles ante dolore genae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tot dextrae? torpescent in amentiā illā?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48579.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow dim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(margaritae) flavescunt et illae senectā rugisque torpescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48579.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become listless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indolent</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne per otium torpescerent manus aut animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium incultu atque socordiā torpescere sinunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliciis et desidia torpescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigor cogebatur senio torpescere rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:14" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
torpidus: <entryFree id="n48580" type="main" key="torpi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">benumbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupefied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torpid</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">torpidos somno insuper pavore exanimat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpidi somno paventesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25</bibl></cit>, <cb n="TORQ" /> 38, 17; <cit><quote lang="la">22, 53, 6: cauda (piscis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 264</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
torpor: <entryFree id="n48581" type="main" key="torpor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torpor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>torpeo</etym>, <sense id="n48581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">numbness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupefaction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torpor</hi> (syn.: languor, veternus). </sense><sense id="n48581.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: tutantur se torpore torpedmes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 50, 127</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 101, 104, § 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:155" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 8, 44, § 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:90" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 28, § 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi membra novus solvit formidine torpor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:867" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 867</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpor gravis illigat artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:548" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 548</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:30 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 2, 30 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n48581.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sluggishness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">listlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactivity</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">implicitas magno torpore cohortes vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpor recens nimiā fortunae indulgentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 99 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torpor Vitellii (opp. vigilantia Vespasiani),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 77</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">procerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utraque res detestabilis est, contractio et torpor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
torporo: <entryFree id="n48582" type="main" key="torpo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torpōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>torpor</etym>, <sense id="n48582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stiffen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benumb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupefy</hi> (ante- and postclass.): aspectus repens cor torporavit homini amore. Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 182, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">umida nimis rigoribus torporata concrescunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
torquatianus: <entryFree id="n48583" type="main" key="Torqua_ti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Torquātĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Torquatus.</entryFree>
torquatus: <entryFree id="n48584" type="main" key="torqua_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torquātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>torques</etym>, <sense id="n48584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adorned with a neck-chain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">collar.</hi> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <trans><tr>presented with a chain for his bravery</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affuit Alecto brevibus torquata colubris,</quote> <trans><tr>with snakes coiled about her neck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palumbus,</quote> <trans><tr>the ring-dove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:67:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 67, 1</bibl></cit>: quid de aliis dicimus, qui calamistratos et torquatos habeant in ministerio, Amhros. Ep. 69, 7.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48585" type="main" key="Torqua_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Torquātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. torquatus</etym>, <sense id="n48585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the surname of T. Manlius</hi>, so called because he put on the neck-chain of a Gaul whom he slew in single combat; also, <hi rend="ital">of his descendants</hi>, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Torquata nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 584</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Torquātĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Torquatus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Torquatian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
torqueo: <entryFree id="n48586" type="main" key="torque^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torquĕo</orth>, <itype>torsi, tortum, 2</itype> (archaic <sense id="n48586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> torquerier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 67</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tre/pw,</foreign> to turn; cf. <foreign lang="greek">a)trekh/s;</foreign> also Sanscr. tarkus; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/traktos,</foreign> a spindle; and <foreign lang="greek">stre/fw,</foreign> to twist</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn about</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away; to twist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wind</hi> (class.; syn. converto). </sense><sense id="n48586.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48586.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cervices oculosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculum,</quote> <trans><tr>to roll</tr>, <tr>distort</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <trans><tr>to twist awry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 36, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab obscenis sermonibus aurem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos ad moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sonitum vocis vestigia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 669</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens squamosos orbes Torquet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillos ferro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to curl</tr>, <tr>frizzle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stamina pollice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 475</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remis aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:644" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 644</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spumas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taxos in arcus,</quote> <trans><tr>to bend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegumen torquens immane leonis,</quote> <trans><tr>winding about him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 666</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum terra circum axem se convertat et torqueat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torta circum bracchia vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48586.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48586.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To whirl around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whirl</hi> in the act of throwing, <hi rend="ital">to wield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brandish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fling with force</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hurl</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">torquet nunc lapidem, nunc ingens machina tignum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis torquet sonantia saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stuppea torquentem Balearis verbera fundae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculum in hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 585</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 323</bibl>: hastam in hunc, id. ib 5, 137; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: hastam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:193" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum aurata ad tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valido pila lacerto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glebas, ramos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fulmina torquet (Juppiter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 208</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and trop.: cum Juppiter horridus austris Torquet aquosam hiemem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 671</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Eurus nubes in occiduum orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 63</bibl></cit>.—In prose: <cit><quote lang="la">torquere amentatas hastas lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 242</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48586.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To twist awry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misplace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">negat sibi umquam, cum oculum torsisset, duas ex lucernā flammulas esse visas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora Tristia temptantum sensu (sapor) torquebit amaro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 247</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48586.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To wrench the limbs upon the rack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put to the rack</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the torture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torture</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ita te nervo torquebo, itidem uti catapultae solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eculeo torqueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:13:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem servilem in modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ira torquentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servum in caput domini,</quote> <trans><tr>against his master</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:18:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: vinctus tortusve, <pb n="1880" /> <cb n="TORR" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n48586.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48586.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to twist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direct</hi> (a favorite expression of Cicero): <cit><quote lang="la">versare suam naturam et regere ad tempus atque huc et illuc torquere ac flectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torquere et flectere imbecillitatem animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:10:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio ita flexibilis, ut sequatur, quocumque torqueas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 16, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ad suae causae commodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:14:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbo ac litterā jus omne torqueri,</quote> <trans><tr>wrested</tr>, <tr>perverted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 27, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonum,</quote> <trans><tr>to inflect</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 14, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta tuo qui bella, pater, sub numine torques,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versare sententias, et huc atque illuc torquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48586.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (acc. to A. 2.), <hi rend="ital">to rack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torture</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">ango, crucio): tuae libidines te torquent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitto aurum coronarium, quod te diutissime torsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 37, 90</bibl></cit>: acriter nos tuae supplicationes torserunt, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem dies noctesque torqueor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbi controversia jam diu torquet Graeculos homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stulti malorum memoriā torquentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:17:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 17, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudine, poenitentia, etc., torquetur mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiā vel amore vigil torquebere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">torqueor, infesto ne vir ab hoste cadat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeacus torquet umbras,</quote> <trans><tr>holds inquisition over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: (reges) dicuntur torquere mero, quem perspexisse laborant, qs. <hi rend="ital">to rack with wine</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to try</hi> or <hi rend="ital">test with wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 435</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vino tortus et irā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48586.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hurl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fling</hi> (of language): <cit><quote lang="la">curvum sermone rotato enthymema,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:449" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 449</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">twisted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crooked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contorted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distorted.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48586.11" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">via (labyrinthi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 42: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a twisted oakgarland</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 349</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48586.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">torta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a twisted loaf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a twist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 16, 3</bibl>. — * </sense><sense id="n48586.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">condiciones,</quote> <trans><tr>confused</tr>, <tr>complicated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 25</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tortē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">awry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crookedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">torte penitusque remota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 305</bibl></cit> (329).</sense></entryFree>
torquis: <entryFree id="n48587" type="main" key="torquis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torquis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">torques</orth> (the first form, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 118</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 10, 44; <sense id="n48587.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">the latter form,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:111" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:517" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 517</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.; <case>acc.</case> torquim, Phoc. de Nom. 1711 P.; <case>abl.</case> torqui, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, 12</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen> <etym>torqueo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a twisted neck-chain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">necklace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">collar.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48587.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">T. Manlius, qui Galli torque detracto, Torquati cognomen invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl>; cf. of the same: torquem detraxit, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Rubrium coronā et phaleris et torque donasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:80:section=185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 80, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aureus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 79</bibl>; Auct. B. Hisp. 26, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl> (al. aurea): aureae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 228, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 10, 44: <cit><quote lang="la">adempta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:601" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjecisse praedam Torquibus exiguis renidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48587.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48587.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A coupling-collar</hi> for oxen: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsis e torquibus aptos Junge pares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 168</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48587.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A wreath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ring</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">avis torque miniato in cervice distincta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 42, 58, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe deum nexis ornatae torquibus arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc vastis urgent immensi torquibus orbes (ceti natantis),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rings</tr>, <tr>circles</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 584</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
torrefacio: <entryFree id="n48588" type="main" key="torre^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torrĕ-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>torreo</etym>, <sense id="n48588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make dry by heat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to parch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torrefy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam vinaceorum duas libras torrefaciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; mostly <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges torrefacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:21:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces avellanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:57:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 57, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sesama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
torrens: <entryFree id="n48589" type="main" key="torrens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of torreo, II.</entryFree>
torrenter: <entryFree id="n48590" type="main" key="torrenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torrenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. torreo, <sense id="n48590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
torreo: <entryFree id="n48591" type="main" key="torreo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torreo</orth>, <itype>torrui, tostum</itype> (<sense id="n48591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. gen. plur.</hi> torrentum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 46</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> torrenti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 9:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 9, 2</bibl>), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. tarsh, to thirst; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/rsomai,</foreign> to become dry; Germ. Durst.; Engl. thirst</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to dry</hi> a thing by heat, <hi rend="ital">to parch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scorch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burn</hi>, etc. (syn. frigo): <cit><quote lang="la">fruges receptas Et torrere parant flammis et frangere saxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 179</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">273</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aristas sole novo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:720" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 720</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes mortuas sole verno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 20, 22, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvam in tegulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 84</bibl></cit> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamsi in Phalaridis tauro inclusus succensis ignibus torrebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: e quibus (terrae cingulis) medium<cb n="TORR" />  illum et maximum solis ardore torreri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum undique flamma torrerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes quos torret Atabulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 78</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">torrentia agros sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: tosti alti stant parietes, i. e. <hi rend="ital">consumed</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. v. 116 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">carmina flammā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:50" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tostos en aspice crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 283</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in veribus exta,</quote> <trans><tr>to roast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in igne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:578" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 578</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus subjecto igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:155" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 155</bibl></cit> et saep.—Of fever heat, <hi rend="ital">to dry up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at mihi (vae miserae) torrentur febribus artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febris viscera ipsa torrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 14:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 14, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:17" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 17</bibl>.—Of thirst: <cit><quote lang="la">et Canis arenti torreat arva siti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:42" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 42</bibl></cit>.—Of the heat of love: <cit><quote lang="la">si torrere jecur quaeris idoneum (Venus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">correptus saevo Veneris torrebar aëno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4). 24, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">torret amor Cyri Lycorida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me torret face mutuā Calais,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me amor Glycerae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femineus pectora torret amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 40</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n48591.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of cold, <hi rend="ital">to nip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pinch</hi> (cf. uro and aduro): frigore torret, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 452, 11</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">torrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, in a <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> sense, <hi rend="ital">burning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflamed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48591.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">terra torrens aestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:19:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles torrens meridiano sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 38, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sirius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 550</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: Sirius torrentior, Claud. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 20.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">torrentissimus axis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:52" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48591.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of streams, <hi rend="ital">rushing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roaring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boiling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">fluvii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus toto gurgite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:409" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 409</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius Novanus solstitiis torrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 229</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 4, 5, § 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 451</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torrentes rapidique cursus amnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:1:9" default="NO">4, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus (aquae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 23:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 23, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 220</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 505</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Padus torrentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 117</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asopos torrentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:316" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 316</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n48591.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">torrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a torrent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fertur quasi torrens oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 18, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 28, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidus montano flumine torrens Sternit agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragosus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 567</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 651</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 7, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Theb. 71" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Theb. 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:319" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 319</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 637</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam direxit bracchia contra torrentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:90" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 90</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48591.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum et virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:189" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:760" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 760</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:7:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48591.6" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">torrens dicentis oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 60</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 3, 7, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copia dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:9" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:261" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 261</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo Promptus et Isaeo torrentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:74" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 74</bibl></cit>.—Of an orator: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (Demosthenem) mirabantur Athenae Torrentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 128</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48591.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se inani verborum torrenti dare,</quote> <trans><tr>a stream of words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo torrente, quo impetu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 24</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">torrenter</orth> (acc. to B.), <hi rend="ital">violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">torrentius amne Hiberno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 198</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
torresco: <entryFree id="n48592" type="hapax" key="torresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n48592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [torreo], <hi rend="ital">to become parched</hi> or <hi rend="ital">burned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">torrescere flammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:890" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 890</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
torrido: <entryFree id="n48593" type="main" key="torri^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torrĭdo</orth>, no <sense id="n48593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>torridus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to scorch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">torris dicitur fax, unde et torridare dicimus comburere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 15, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anhelis ardoribus torridatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 602</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
torridus: <entryFree id="n48594" type="main" key="torri^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torrĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>torreo</etym>, <sense id="n48594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dried up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torrid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48594.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1220</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:372" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 372</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">campi siccitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:43:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 43, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:4" default="NO">7, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">farra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes rivique,</quote> <trans><tr>dried up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:28:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 28, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">zona ab igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 234</bibl></cit>: homo vegrandi macie torridus, <hi rend="ital">dried</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shrivelled up</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">color sole,</quote> <trans><tr>embrowned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 20, 43, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <trans><tr>dry</tr>, <tr>hoarse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:3:59" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 239</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48594.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of cold (cf. torreo, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">pecora jumentaque torrida frigore,</quote> <trans><tr>pinched</tr>, <tr>nipped</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 32, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra torrida gelu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 40, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <trans><tr>biting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:107" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
torris: <entryFree id="n48595" type="main" key="torris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torris</orth> (collat. forms <orth extent="full" lang="la">torrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 15, 30</bibl>; Fragm. Trag. v. 452 Rib.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">torres</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:915" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 915</bibl> Lachm.), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firebrand</hi> (with or without flame; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. titio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 457</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 512</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12</bibl>, <cb n="TORU" /> 272, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 298</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:115" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 115</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 14, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
torror: <entryFree id="n48596" type="main" key="torror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torror</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>torreo</etym>, <sense id="n48596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drying up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scorching</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:76" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 76</bibl></cit>: corporis, a transl. of <foreign lang="greek">h(li/wsis,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
torsio: <entryFree id="n48597" type="main" key="torsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>torqueo</etym>, <sense id="n48597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wringing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">griping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 6, 13, 8</bibl></cit>; <number>plur.</number>: torsiones et dolores, <hi rend="ital">torments</hi>, Vulg. lsa. 13, 8.</sense></entryFree>
torta: <entryFree id="n48598" type="main" key="torta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torta</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen>, v. torqueo <sense id="n48598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
torte: <entryFree id="n48599" type="main" key="torte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tortē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. torqueo <sense id="n48599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
torticordius: <entryFree id="n48600" type="hapax" key="torti^cordi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tortĭcordĭus</orth>, a. <itype>um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tortuscor</etym>, <sense id="n48600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perverse in heart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 146:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 146, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tortilis: <entryFree id="n48601" type="main" key="torti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tortĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>torqueo</etym>, <sense id="n48601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twisted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winding</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. sinuosus): aurum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a golden chain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bucina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ansa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscis,</quote> <trans><tr>crooked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:915" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 915</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pampinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 51, 74, § 163</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tortio: <entryFree id="n48602" type="main" key="torti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tortĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torture</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tortione legitimā peribunt, Firm. Math. 8, 15: vesicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
tortivus: <entryFree id="n48603" type="main" key="torti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tortīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pressed out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squeezed out</hi> (by subjecting the grapes a second time to the press): <cit><quote lang="la">mustum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 23, 4</bibl></cit>; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 21, 25, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:36" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:21:217" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 21, 217</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
torto: <entryFree id="n48604" type="main" key="torto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to torture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi> (ante- and post-class.; syn.: torqueo, crucio): ubi insilui in cochleatum eculeum, ibi tolutim tortor, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 105, 15</bibl>, and 182, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 661</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 106</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tortor: <entryFree id="n48605" type="main" key="tortor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tortor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>torqueo, I. B. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n48605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an executioner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tormentor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torturer.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48605.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48605.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam tortor, atque essent tormenta ipsa defessa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:63:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 63, 177</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:12:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 12, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 14:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:21" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 21</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48605.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">He that brandishes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handles.</hi> Balearis habenae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 710</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48605.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tortor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <hi rend="ital">an epithet of Apollo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as the flayer of Marsyas</hi>, under which name he was worshipped in a part of Rome, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n48605.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">occultum quatiente animo tortore flagellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:195" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 195</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tortula: <entryFree id="n48606" type="main" key="tortu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tortŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>torta; v. <itype>torqueo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></etym>, <sense id="n48606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small twist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 11, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tortum: <entryFree id="n48607" type="main" key="tortum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tortum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>torqueo</etym>, <sense id="n48607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rope</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 179, 16</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. v. 159 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
tortuose: <entryFree id="n48608" type="main" key="tortu^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tortŭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tortuosus <sense id="n48608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tortuositas: <entryFree id="n48609" type="main" key="tortu^o_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tortŭōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tortuosus</etym>, <sense id="n48609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crookedness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shuffling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevarication</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">qualis est tortuositas vestra?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carn. Chr. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tortuosus: <entryFree id="n48610" type="main" key="tortu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tortŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tortus</etym>. <sense id="n48610.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Full of crooks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tortuous</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n48610.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">est autem (alvus) multiplex et tortuosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 57, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serrula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 64, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per tortuosi amnis sinus flexusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:47:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 47, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 27, 1</bibl></cit>: coluber, id.
