Job, 26, 13.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiddam tortuosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 46, 106, § 255</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48610.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">entangled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">involved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complicated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tortuosum genus disputandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visa quaedam tortuosa et obscura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:63:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 63, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res anxiae et tortuosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis aperit tortuosissimam istam et implicatissimam nodositatem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 2, 10</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n48610.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Painful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torturing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rusci radix bibitur in tortuosiore urinā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in strangury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 27, 100, § 173</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tortŭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">crookedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tortuously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">procedat serpens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 4, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
tortura: <entryFree id="n48611" type="main" key="tortu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tortūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>torqueo</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n48611.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A twisting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wreathing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 9, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48611.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torture</hi>: ventris, <hi rend="ital">the gripes. colic.</hi> = tormina: <cit><quote lang="la">tortura et extensio ventris dolorque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tortus: <entryFree id="n48612" type="main" key="tortus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of torqueo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48613" type="main" key="tortus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tortus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>torqueo</etym>. <sense id="n48613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a twisting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winding; a wreath</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): tortu multiplicabili Draco, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 22: draco tortu terribilis, id. poët. Div. 2, 30, 63.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens Nequicquam longos fugiens dat corpore tortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bucinarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 196</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n48613.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A whirling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flexae habenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 421</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
torulus: <entryFree id="n48614" type="main" key="to^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏrŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>torus; a little ele <pb n="1881" /> <cb n="TORV" /> vation; hence</etym>, <sense id="n48614.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tuft</hi> of hair: <cit><quote lang="la">tum meo patri autem torulus inerit aureus Sub petaso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 144</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">torulo capiti circumflexo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torulus in capite mulieris ornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=167" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 167</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n48614.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The</hi> (dilated) <hi rend="ital">muscle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the brawn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fleshy part</hi> of the body: <cit><quote lang="la">terga pulposis torulis obesa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 195, 12</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48614.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the sap-wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alburnum</hi> of a tree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
torus: <entryFree id="n48615" type="main" key="to^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 11, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 23, 15</bibl>) [for storus; root ster-, stra-, of sterno, stramen; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">store/nnumi,</foreign> to spread, scatter], prop., <sense id="n48615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swelling</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">bulging place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an elevation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protuberance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prominence;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n48615.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A knot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bulge</hi>: (funis) <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 135, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">funiculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis toris ad arborem religetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmi vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 16:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48615.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The muscular</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fleshy part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the muscle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brawn</hi> of animal bodies (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): o lacertorum tori! Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 22; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:854" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 854</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 402</bibl>; 14, 283; 15, 230; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo gaudet comantes Excutiens cervice toros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriatque toris animosum pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 18, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1042" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1042</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:245" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 245</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venarum tori,</quote> <trans><tr>varicose dilatations of the veins</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n48615.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the bulge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thickness</hi> of trees: <cit><quote lang="la">utile toros futuri draconis pasci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 211</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(asparagus) in toros striatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 363, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48615.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A raised ornament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a knot</hi>, on a garland; <cit><quote lang="la">trop., of language: isque (stilus mediocris) uno tenore fluit, aut addit aliquos, ut in coronā, toros omnemque orationem ornamentis modicis verborum sententiarumque distinguit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:6:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 6, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48615.5" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bolster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cushion</hi>, so named from its protuberances; hence, <hi rend="ital">a couch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sofa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bed</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: stratum, lectus): antiquis torus e stramento erat, qualiter etiam nunc in castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridante toro consederat herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 388</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praebuit herba torum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 655</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">datque torum caespes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:556" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 556</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramine vestitis accubuere toris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:402" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestrem montana torum cum sterneret uxor Frondibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discumbere toris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 565</bibl></cit>.—So of a <hi rend="ital">sofa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">toro sic orsus ab alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 579</bibl>.—Of a <hi rend="ital">bed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambierantque torum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concutiuntque torum de molli fluminis ulvā Impositum lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:655" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebeno sublimis in atrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:610" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 610</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 73</bibl>. — Of a <hi rend="ital">corpse-bed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 503</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:668" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 668</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra toro defleta reponunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 220</bibl></cit>.—Of a <hi rend="ital">bridalbed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 431</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lectica) sive illa toro resupina feretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 487</bibl></cit>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 2, p. 240 (2d ed.).—</sense><sense id="n48615.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like thalamus, as a designation for <hi rend="ital">marriage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deucalion ... Cum consorte tori,</quote> <trans><tr>with his consort</tr>, <tr>spouse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 319</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">socia tori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:620" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 620</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 91</bibl>; 7, 332; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:511" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 511</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">genialis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obscenus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>illicit connection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:378" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 378</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">illiciti (with stupra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 97" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">receptus in torum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 6, § 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, also, for <hi rend="ital">a mistress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">torum donare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 87</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48615.7" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An elevation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bank</hi> of earth: <cit><quote lang="la">riparum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 674</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:819" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 819</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 20, § 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:76" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 34, § 76</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48615.8" n="VI" level="1"> In architecture, <hi rend="ital">a large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round moulding at the base of a column</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a torus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
torvidus: <entryFree id="n48616" type="hapax" key="torvi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>torvus</etym>, <sense id="n48616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 196</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
torvitas: <entryFree id="n48617" type="main" key="torvi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wildness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savageness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sternness</hi> of aspect, character, etc. (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">torvitas vultūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis (pantherae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 17, 23, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 19, 18, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Agrippa, vir rusticitati propior quam deliciis ... verum eadem illa torvitas tabulas duas Ajacis et Veneris mercata est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 4, 9, § 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
torviter: <entryFree id="n48618" type="main" key="torvi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torvĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. torvus <sense id="n48618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
torvus: <entryFree id="n48619" type="main" key="torvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">torvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. for torg-vus; Sanscr. root targ-, to threaten</etym>, orig. of the eyes, <sense id="n48619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">staring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piercing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stern;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">savage</hi>, in aspect or character (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; syn.: trux, truculentus, ferus): ille tuens oculis immitem Phinea <cb n="TOT" /> torvis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1</bibl>, ext. 6: <cit><quote lang="la">cernimus astantes lumine torvo Aetnaeos fratres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 677</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 27</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspicit hanc torvis (sc. oculis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:35:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 35, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:160" default="NO">11, 3, 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma minantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:8:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus (equi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 42, 64, § 154</bibl></cit> optima torvae Forma bovis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons (Polyphemi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 636</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torvi cymba senis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit> (4, 17), 24: feroci ingenio torvus praegrandi gradu, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=355" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 355</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">torvu' draco serpit, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 106: angues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leaena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvencus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 115</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 237: Medusa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ister (as a horned river-god),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:218" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 218</bibl></cit> et saep.: ferox et torva confidentia, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=355" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 355</bibl> Müll.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">proclia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>harsh</tr>, <tr>sharp</tr>, <tr>tart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 213</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voce hominis et tuba rudore torvior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor 3, p. 357</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leonis torvissima facies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 196</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48619.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">torvum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">torva</orth>, adverb., <hi rend="ital">fiercely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sternly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sharply</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">torvumque repente Clamat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torvum lacrimans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:127" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torva tuens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 467</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:255" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 255</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">torvĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sharply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sternly</hi> (ante-class.): aliquem increpare, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 516, 16</bibl> (Ann. v. 79 Vahl.); Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 516, 15</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 18 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
tosilla: <entryFree id="n48620" type="main" key="tosilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tosilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. tonsilla.</entryFree>
tostus: <entryFree id="n48621" type="main" key="tostus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tostus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of torreo.</entryFree>
tot: <entryFree id="n48622" type="main" key="to^t"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏt</orth>, <sense id="n48622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adj. indecl.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so many.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48622.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48622.2" n="A" level="2"> With a corresp. <hi rend="ital">quot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quotiens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quantum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48622.3" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">quot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc brevissime dicam, neminem umquam tam impudentem fuisse, qui ab dis immortalibus tot et tantas res tacitus auderet optare, quot et quantas di immortales ad Cn. Pompeium detulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 16, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot homines, tot causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:32:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 32, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tot annos, quot habet, designatus consul fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 8</bibl></cit>, b, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">quot haberet corpora pulvis, Tot mihi natales contingere vana rogavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot mala sum passus, quot in aethere sidera lucent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48622.4" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">quotiens</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tot consulibus meruisset, quotiens ipse consul fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tot labores et pericula suscepissem, quotiens ductu meo hostes fusi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:96:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 96, 1</bibl></cit> Dietsch. — </sense><sense id="n48622.5" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">quantum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum putabis ei rei satis esse, tot vites ablaqueato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 114, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48622.6" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae cum viderem tot vestigiis impressa, ut in his errari non posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48622.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> </sense><sense id="n48622.8" n="1" level="3"> In connection with <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> of kindred meaning, <hi rend="ital">so many</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so great a number</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquae tot et tantae et tam graves civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:5:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 5, § 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tot tantaeque difficultates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">in his tot et tantis malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:10:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 10, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot viri ac tales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:28:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 28, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot ac tam validae manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 26, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot, tam valida oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 54, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec tot tam inopinata incerti stupentesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 37, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">repeated: ille cultus tot nobilium virorum, tot illustrium feminarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48622.9" n="2" level="3"> Alone, the <hi rend="ital">correl.-clause</hi> being implied from the context, <hi rend="ital">so many</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such a great number</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so very many</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">en excetra tu, quae tibi amicos tot habes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc domi nostrae tot pessumi vivunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot me impediunt curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tot signis eadem natura declaret, quid velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:10:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 10, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex centum quattuor centuriis, tot enim reliquae sunt (centuriae), etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot civitatum conjuratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde tot hostes subito exorti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 37, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot caede procorum Admonitus non est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 624</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tot curis regem videret urgeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:7:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 7, 13</bibl></cit>.—Rarely without a <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an timebant, ne tot unum ... superare non possent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:28:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 28, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex tot in Atridā pars quota laudis erat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 12, 10</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">omnes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot omnibus saeculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48622.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48622.11" n="A" level="2"> To designate an optional, indefinite number, <hi rend="ital">so many</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such and such a number</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volo dari ei, qui id egerit, a ceteris heredibus aureos tot,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:5:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 5, 8</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48622.12" n="B" level="2"> As a relative numeral, also, for <hi rend="ital">so few</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix credent tantum rerum cepisse tot annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0800,001:1:339" default="NO"><author>Albin.</author> 1, 339</bibl></cit>. <cb n="TOTU" /></sense></entryFree>
totidem: <entryFree id="n48623" type="main" key="to^ti^dem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏtĭdem</orth>, <sense id="n48623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adj. indecl.</hi> [tot, with the demonstr. syllable dem affixed, as in tantundem], <hi rend="ital">just so many</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as many.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48623.1" n="I" level="1"> With a foll. <hi rend="ital">quot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">talentis magnis totidem, quot ego et tu sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 114</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot orationum genera esse diximus, totidem oratorum reperiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totidem, quot dixit, ut aiunt, scripta verbis oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:328" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 96, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totidem verbis, quot Stoici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totidem (partus) quot equae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 168</bibl></cit>. — Rarely with <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum totidem navibus atque erat profectus Athenas rediret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48623.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Procles et Eurysthenes gemini fratres fuerunt: at hi nec totidem annos vixerunt, anno enim Procli vita brevior fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 43, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula quam modo totidem fere verbis interpretatus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 100</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum milia erant sex, totidem numero pedites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor ventos a totidem mundi cardinibus flare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille talenta rotundentur, totidem altera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bene promittant, totidem promittite verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 461</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48623.3" n="B" level="2"> Rarely without a <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixerit insanum qui me totidem audiet (sc. verba),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>will hear the same thing just as often from me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 298</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
totiens: <entryFree id="n48624" type="main" key="to^ti^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏtĭens</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏtĭes</orth>, <pos>adv. num.</pos> <etym>tot</etym>, <sense id="n48624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">so often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so many times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as many times.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48624.1" n="A" level="2"> With a corresp. <hi rend="ital">quotiens</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totiens, quotiens praescribitur, Paeanem citare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quotiens verbum aliquod est scribendum nobis, totiens, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 30, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud soleo mirari, non me totiens accipere tuas litteras, quotiens a Quinto mihi fratre afferantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quotienscumque dico, totiens mihi videor, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 18, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48624.2" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">quot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moverat eum subeunda dimicatio totiens, quot conjurati superessent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48624.3" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot praetores in Siciliā fuerunt: totiens apud majores nostros Siculi senatum adierunt, totiens hac memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:60:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 60, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim mihi ignoscas, quod ad te scribo tam multa totiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pro republicā seditiosum civem totiens compescuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ego sim totiens jam dedignata maritos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter die claro totiensque gratā Nocte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:23" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
totietas: <entryFree id="n48625" type="main" key="to_ti^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tōtĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entirety</hi> (late Lat.), Rustic. c. Aceph. p. 1182.</sense></entryFree>
totjugus: <entryFree id="n48626" type="main" key="totju^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tot-jŭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jugum</etym>, <sense id="n48626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">so many</hi> (Appuleian): <cit><quote lang="la">totjugis diebus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 125, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invitamenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 4, p. 360, 3</bibl></cit>.— Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">totjŭgis</orth>, e: <cit><quote lang="la">homo totjugi scientiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, p. 346, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
totus: <entryFree id="n48627" type="main" key="to_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<sense id="n48627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> tōtīus, but scanned tōtĭus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:984" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 984</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:275" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 275</bibl>; 3, 989; 4, 1028; 5, 477 al.; collat. form of the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: toti familiae, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 694</bibl> P.; <case>dat.</case> toti; but <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto exercitui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto orbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit> (4, 10), 57; <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: totae familiae, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=103" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 103</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">totae insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; and: totae rei, Auct. Her. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 678</bibl> P.), <hi rend="ital">all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all the</hi> (denoting a thing in its entireness), <hi rend="ital">the whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">total.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48627.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut unum opus, totum atque perfectum ex omnibus totis atque perfectis absolveret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui senatus totam rem publicam, omnem Italiae pubem, cuncta populi Romani arma commiserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 23, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum corpus rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne caelum, totamque cum universo mari terram mente complexus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut totā mente atque omnibus artubus contremiscam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">universā re et totā sententiā dissidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes totae confulgebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eant per totam caveam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> prol. 66: <cit><quote lang="la">pervigilat noctes totas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eāque totā nocte continenter ierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Romae per totam urbem vigiliae haberentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tota se luna sub orbem solis subjecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 36, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ipsa Peloponnesus fere tota in mari est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—In <case>abl.</case>, without <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concursabat urbe totā maxima multitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:35:section=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 35, § 93</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">urbe totā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totā Asiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; id. Imp. <pb n="1882" /> <cb n="TRAB" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Pomp.</author> 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totā Siciliā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Verr. 2:2:49:section=120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 49, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totā Italiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totā provinciā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:95 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 95 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. Hand, Turs. III. p. 248 sq.; Haase ad Reisig, Vorles. p. 708; Zumpt, Gram. § 482. — Less freq. with <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totāque in Italiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:35:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 35, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Siciliā totā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in toto inperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in toto orbe terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:45:section=99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 45, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in totā vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in toto imperio tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:11:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 11, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto in orbe terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totā in civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 14, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48627.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. in agreement with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> where we use an <pos>adv.</pos> qualifying the <hi rend="ital">verb</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">altogether</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entirely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota sum misera in metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ctesipho in amore est totus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid meditans nugarum, totus in illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totus et mente et animo in bellum insistit,</quote> <trans><tr>applied himself wholly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui esset totus ex fraude et mendacio factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus in usu sui tota posita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sum totus vester,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catoni studio meo me totum ab adulescentiā dedidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">homines qui se totos tradiderunt voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsum est id totum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:15:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 15, 28</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48627.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48627.4" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the whole</hi>, opp. dimidium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apocol. 8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apocol. 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. pars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum in eo est, tectorium ut concinnum sit,</quote> <trans><tr>all depends on this</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: totum in eo sit, ne contractentur pocula, Col 12, 4, 3. — </sense><sense id="n48627.5" n="B" level="2"> Adverb. phrases with a <pos>prep.</pos> </sense><sense id="n48627.6" n="1" level="3"> Ex toto, <hi rend="ital">wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entirely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">altogether</hi>, <hi rend="ital">totally</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">creta ex toto repudianda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:8:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:17" default="NO">5, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:2" default="NO">2, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 6, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:12:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 12, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:2:6:3" default="NO">2, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:3:12:4" default="NO">3, 12, 4</bibl>; 3, 42, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 75:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 75, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 17, 17, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 14</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; 8, 20 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; 7, 4, 3 and 9; 7, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 8, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:8:72" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 8, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:8:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:3:16:24" default="NO">3, 16, 24</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n48627.7" n="2" level="3"> In toto, <hi rend="ital">upon the whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generally</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 20, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48627.8" n="3" level="3"> In totum (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n48627.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Wholly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entirely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">altogether</hi>, <hi rend="ital">totally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res in totum diversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 42, § 90</bibl></cit>; id. praef. § 26; 2, 90, 92, § 205; 10, 4, 5, § 16; 25, 4, 17, § 36; 35, 2, 2, § 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 9, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:63" default="NO">4, 1, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:72" default="NO">4, 1, 72</bibl>; 7, 1, 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:1:2" default="NO">2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:17:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 72:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 72, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:27:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 2, 27, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 1, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48627.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Upon the whole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in general</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in totum praecipimus: ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:80" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:31" default="NO">3, 2, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48628" type="main" key="to^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tŏtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tot</etym>, <sense id="n48628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">so great a</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quotcumque pedum spatia facienda censueris, totam partem longitudinis et latitudinis duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota pars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 416</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
toxico: <entryFree id="n48629" type="main" key="toxi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">toxĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">anoint with poison;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: sagitta toxicata. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Tob. 7, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
toxicon: <entryFree id="n48630" type="greek" key="toxi^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">toxĭcon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tociko/n,</foreign> <sense id="n48630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of</hi> ladanum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 30, § 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
toxicum: <entryFree id="n48631" type="greek" key="toxi^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">toxĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tociko/n;</foreign> orig., <sense id="n48631.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a poison in which arrows were dipped</hi>, Caecil. and Afran. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=355" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 355</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:7:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 7, 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 20, § 51</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48631.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">poison</hi>, in gen. (syn. venenum); <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:61" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 35</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:820" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 820</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:19:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 19, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trabalis: <entryFree id="n48632" type="main" key="tra^ba_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăbālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>trabs</etym>, <sense id="n48632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to beams</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beam-.</hi> clavus, <hi rend="ital">a spike</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 18</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">prov: ut hoc beneficium, quemadmodum dicitur, trabali clavo figeret,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>very fast</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 5, 21, § 53</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: telum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">beam-like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stout as a beam</hi> (Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 12, 294</bibl> (Ann. v. 589 Vahl.); imitated by Verg. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:301" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 301</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:6" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceptrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 318</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
trabaria: <entryFree id="n48633" type="main" key="tra^ba_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăbārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>trabs; sc. navis</etym>, <sense id="n48633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small vessel made of the trunk of a tree</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 1, 27</bibl></sense></entryFree>
trabea: <entryFree id="n48634" type="main" key="tra^be^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăbĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a robe of state</hi> of augurs, kings, knights, etc. </sense><sense id="n48634.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Suet. Fragm. ap <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 612</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:136" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 39, 63, § 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:503" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 503</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 188</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 612</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 334 al.</bibl> — </sense><sense id="n48634.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48634.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The equestrian order</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:17" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:41:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 41, 5</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48634.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The consulate</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 1, 243</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 9:112" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 9, 112</bibl>. <cb n="TRAC" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48635" type="main" key="Tra^be^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trăbĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Q., <sense id="n48635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient Roman comic poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:31:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 31, 67</bibl>; Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:24" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trabealis: <entryFree id="n48636" type="main" key="tra^be^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăbĕālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. trabea</etym>, <sense id="n48636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> trabea: <cit><quote lang="la">metallum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trabeatus: <entryFree id="n48637" type="main" key="tra^be^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăbĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dressed in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wearing a</hi> trabea. </sense><sense id="n48637.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quirinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:37" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:828" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 828</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also agmina,</quote> <trans><tr>the knights</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:32" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of a consul</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 338</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">colonus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>consul</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 417</bibl></cit>: quies, <hi rend="ital">of the consuls</hi>, Cod. Th. 10, 10, 33. — </sense><sense id="n48637.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trăbĕ-āta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. fabula), <hi rend="ital">a kind of drama</hi>, so called by C. Melissus, prob. from the knights represented in it, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trabecula: <entryFree id="n48638" type="main" key="tra^be^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăbĕcŭla</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trăbĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>trabs</etym>, <sense id="n48638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little beam</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 207, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trabes: <entryFree id="n48639" type="main" key="tra^bes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăbes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. trabs <sense id="n48639.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
trabica: <entryFree id="n48640" type="main" key="tra^bi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăbĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. navis) [trabs], <sense id="n48640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel made of beams fastened together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a raft</hi>: trabica in alveos, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=367" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 367</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. v. 406 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
trabs: <entryFree id="n48641" type="main" key="trabs"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trabs</orth>, <itype>trăbis</itype> (ante-class. collat. form of the <case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">trăbes</orth>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:15:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 15, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:16:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 16, 61</bibl>, or Trag. v. 281 Vahl.; Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=33" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 33</bibl> Müll., or Ann. v. 598 Vahl.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">tra/phc</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n48641.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a beam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a timber</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna trabesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:192 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 192 sq.</bibl></cit>; v. tignum; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 38, 73, § 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:13:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 13, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 78</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48641.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48641.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva frequens trabibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 329</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:360" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 360</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">securi Saucia trabs ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:373" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 373</bibl></cit>; cf. Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 178, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 22, 38: <cit><quote lang="la">fraxineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus trabibus obscurus acernis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 87</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:640" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 640</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48641.3" n="B" level="2"> Any thing made of beams or timbers. </sense><sense id="n48641.4" n="1" level="3"> Very freq., <hi rend="ital">a ship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vessel</hi>: abiegna trabes, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 75</bibl>: trabes rostrata per altum, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=33" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam mare turbari trabibus ... vide bis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 566</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut trabe Cypria Myrtoum pavidus nauta secet mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:76" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thessalica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 120" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48641.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A roof</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub trabe citreā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; so in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 3</bibl>; 3, 2, 28. —</sense><sense id="n48641.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A battering - ram</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ballista</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:383" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 383</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48641.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A javelin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:566" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 566</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 124</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48641.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A club</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cudgel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:621" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 621</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48641.9" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A table</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:91:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 91, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48641.10" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A torch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 103" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 103</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48641.11" n="8" level="3"> In mal. part. = mentula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 28, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48641.12" n="C" level="2"> A fiery phenomenon in the heavens, <hi rend="ital">a meteor</hi>: emicant et trabes simili modo, quas <foreign lang="greek">dokou\s</foreign> vocant, qualis cum Lacedaemonii classe victi imperium Graeciae amisere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 26, 26, § 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes et globi et faces et ardores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:1:1:15" default="NO">1, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:1:15:4" default="NO">1, 15, 4</bibl>; 7, 4, 3-5; 7, 5, 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 94, 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trachala: <entryFree id="n48642" type="greek" key="Tra^cha_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trăchāla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*traxala=s,</foreign> <sense id="n48642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Bullnecked</hi>, an epithet of Constantine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 41" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trachallus: <entryFree id="n48643" type="main" key="Trachallus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trachallus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ālus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an orator contemporary with Quintilian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:119" default="NO">10, 1, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:5" default="NO">12, 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trachas: <entryFree id="n48644" type="main" key="Tra_chas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trāchas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tra/xhs,</foreign> <sense id="n48644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the town usually called</hi> Tarracina, <hi rend="ital">near the Pomptine Marshes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 717</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trachia: <entryFree id="n48645" type="greek" key="tra_chi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāchīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">traxei=a,</foreign> <sense id="n48645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the windpipe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trachea</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trachin: <entryFree id="n48646" type="main" key="Tra_chi_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trāchīn</orth>, <itype>īnis</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trāchȳn</orth>, <itype>ȳnos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*traxi/n</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*traxu/n,</foreign> <sense id="n48646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on Mount Œta</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Hercules caused himself to be burned</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 14, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 135" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:195" default="NO">195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:1432" default="NO">1432</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 818" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Troad. 818</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 627</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trāchīnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Trachin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Trachinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ceyx</tr>, <tr>king of Trachin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 351</bibl></cit>; called also, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, Trachinius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:282" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 282</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">puppis,</quote> <trans><tr>the vessel in which Ceyx was shipwrecked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:502" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 114, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Halcyone,</quote> <trans><tr>the consort of Ceyx</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:57" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 57</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trāchīnĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">The Trachinian Women</hi>, a tragedy of Sophocles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 8, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tracta: <entryFree id="n48647" type="main" key="tracta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tracta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. <itype>traho</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> B. 2.</entryFree>
tractabilis: <entryFree id="n48648" type="main" key="tracta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tractābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tracto</etym>, <sense id="n48648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be touched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handled</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">taken hold of; that may be wrought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manageable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tractable</hi> (class). <cb n="TRAC" /> </sense><sense id="n48648.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractabile omne necesse est esse, quod natum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tofi in opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 48, § 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italicum genus falcium vel inter vepres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 28, 67, § 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 17, 68, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>portable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:84" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est mare, confiteor, nondum tractabile nanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non tractabile caelum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>inclement</tr>, <tr>stormy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <trans><tr>tractable</tr>, <tr>flexible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 40</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcera tractabiliora fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 13, 39, § 117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48648.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pliant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yielding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manageable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tractable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus est cum multis in rebus, tum in amicitiā tenera et tractabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullis ille movetur Fletibus aut voces ullas tractabilis audit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impatiens animus nec adhuc tractabilis arte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mite ac tractabile ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod te tam tractabilem video, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 24, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est enim eo (filio) tractabilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agrippa nihilo tractabilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tractābĭ-lĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">without opposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tractably</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tractabilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:2:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
