tractabilitas: <entryFree id="n48649" type="main" key="tracta_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tractābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tractabilis</etym>, <sense id="n48649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fitness for being handled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wrought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manageableness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tractability</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">populus, salix, tilia in sculpturis commodam praestant tractabilitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tractabiliter: <entryFree id="n48650" type="main" key="tracta_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tractābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tractabilis <sense id="n48650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tractatio: <entryFree id="n48651" type="main" key="tracta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tractātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tracto</etym>. <sense id="n48651.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a handling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">management</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treatment</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero qui fidibus aut tibiis uti volunt, ab haruspicibus accipiunt earum tractationem, sed a musicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:52:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 52, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beluarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractatio atque usus vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus et tractatio dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 23, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assidua veterum scriptorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:21:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est in utroque (in poësi et in oratione solutā) et materia et tractatio, materia in verbis, tractatio in collocatione verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:201" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 59, 201</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48651.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48651.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Treatment</hi> of a person, i. e. <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">behavior</hi> towards him (post-Aug., and mostly in jurid. lang.): <cit><quote lang="la">maritus uxori, si malae tractationis accusabitur, non inverecunde dicet, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>of maltreatment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:10 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 10 sq.</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:29" default="NO">7, 4, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:2" default="NO">7, 3, 2</bibl>; 4, 2, 30; 9, 2, 79; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 7</bibl>; Tert. Poen. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n48651.3" n="B" level="2"> In rhet. lang. </sense><sense id="n48651.4" n="1" level="3"> A rhetorical figure, <hi rend="ital">the treatment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discussion</hi> of a subject, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:41:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 41, 177</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n48651.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A special use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usage</hi> of a word, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tractator: <entryFree id="n48652" type="main" key="tracta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tractātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n48652.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slave among the Romans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who manipulated and suppled his master</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s limbs while anointing them; a shampooer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:53" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48652.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A handler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treater</hi> of any thing. esp. of literary matters (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Origenes scaevus cavendusque tractator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Helv. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Get. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tractatorium: <entryFree id="n48653" type="hapax" key="tracta_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tractātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where deliberations were held</hi>, <hi rend="ital">causes tried</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">a place of business</hi>, <hi rend="ital">session-room</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tractatrix: <entryFree id="n48654" type="main" key="tracta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tractātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tractator</etym>, <sense id="n48654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female shampooer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tractatus: <entryFree id="n48655" type="main" key="tracta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tractātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tracto</etym>, <sense id="n48655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a touching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">working.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48655.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): nucum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantae tractatu mansuescunt ut ferae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 10, 12, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tofacea aspera tractatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 7, 4, § 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48655.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a handling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">management</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treatment</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in Quint.): artium (corresp. to the preced. tractantur), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:23:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 23, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperiorum tractatu rerum atteruntur (ingenia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 2; so, <cit><quote lang="la">artis hujusce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">5: communis locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">troporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequi bonique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:3" default="NO">12, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicialis officii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:94:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 94, 4</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractatus omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48655.3" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of mental handling. <hi rend="ital">reflection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consideration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de copiis expensisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:5:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cognitio prolixiorem tractatum habeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 36, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tractatu habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 48, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48655.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A consultation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discussion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tractatu habito societas coïta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1883" /> <cb n="TRAC" /> 2, 32: <cit><quote lang="la">diu multumque tractatu inter nos habito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 3, 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48655.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in concr. </sense><sense id="n48655.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A treatise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tractate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">separatim toto tractatu sententia ejus judicanda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 5, § 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48655.7" n="2" level="3"> In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a sermon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">homily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractatus populares, quos Graece homilias vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Haeres. 4 praef" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Haeres. 4 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
tracticius: <entryFree id="n48656" type="main" key="Tracti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tractīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>traho</etym>, <sense id="n48656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">The Dragged</hi>, a nickname of Heliogabalus, who, after having been slain, was dragged through the streets, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 23" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Ep. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tractim: <entryFree id="n48657" type="main" key="tractim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tractim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>tractus</etym>, <sense id="n48657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by drawing along</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">little by little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by degress; in a drawling way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at length</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slowly</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose), Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 418 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid, si ego illum tractim tangam, ut dormiat?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>should stroke him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 530</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:118" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">susurrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 260</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sonat jucundo hiatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:20:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: tractim pronuntiata littera <hi rend="ital">i</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">pronounced long</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:6:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 6, 6</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also, dicere (opp. festinanter),</quote> <trans><tr>slowly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 40:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 40, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tractitius: <entryFree id="n48658" type="main" key="Tracti_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tractītĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Tracticius.</entryFree>
tracto: <entryFree id="n48659" type="main" key="tracto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tracto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (<sense id="n48659.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur. part.</hi> tractantum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 20</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>traho</etym>. </sense><sense id="n48659.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To draw violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tug</hi>, <hi rend="ital">haul</hi>, etc. (so, very rare): qui te (Hectorem) sic tractavere? Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Trag. v. 96 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">tractatus per aequora campi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ann. v. 140</bibl></cit> Vahl.: <cit><quote lang="la">tractata comis antistita Phoebi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malis morsuque ferarum Tractari,</quote> <trans><tr>to be torn</tr>, <tr>rent</tr>, <tr>lacerated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:889" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 889</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48659.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take in hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wield; to exercise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.; cf.: tango, ago, perago). </sense><sense id="n48659.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea, quae gustemus, olfaciamus, tractemus, audiamus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:38:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 38, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam temere tinnit tintinnabulum, nisi qui illud tractat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractavisti hospitam ante aedes meas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mateilionem Corinthium cupidissime tractans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucra, quae non possum tractare sine magno gemitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aret Pellis et ad tactum tractanti dura resistit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer unctis Tractavit calicem manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulos consuescere manu tractari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractat inauratae consona fila lyrae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>strikes</tr>, <tr>plays upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 60</bibl></cit>: necdum res igni scibant tractare, <hi rend="ital">to prepare</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to cook</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:953" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 953</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum terrae aere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1289</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lutosum agrum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to till</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractari tuerique vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceram pollice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 285</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:196" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 196</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanuginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernacula,</quote> <trans><tr>to manage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <trans><tr>to wield</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">speciosius arma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus, qui meam bibliothecen multorum nummorum tractavit,</quote> <trans><tr>has taken care of</tr>, <tr>had charge of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:77:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 77, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: eras tu quaestor; <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam publicam tu tractabas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem Prusensium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 28, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48659.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to handle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n48659.5" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: ut ne res temere tractent turbidas, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:45:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 45, 199</bibl> (Trag. v. 189 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">suam rem minus caute et cogitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas amicorum tractare atque agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam difficiliorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condiciones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>to conduct</tr>, <tr>carry on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 28, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:8:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:5:4" default="NO">22, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:466" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 466</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam vulgivago more ferarum,</quote> <trans><tr>to lead</tr>, <tr>pass</tr>, <tr>spend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:930" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 930</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 24, 33</bibl></cit> (al. transactam): <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauca admodum vi tractata, quo ceteris quies esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem,</quote> <trans><tr>to practise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba vetera,</quote> <trans><tr>to employ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personam in scenā,</quote> <trans><tr>to perform</tr>, <tr>act</tr>, <tr>represent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Rosc. Com. 7:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">partes secundas (mimus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 28, 97</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 85</bibl>.—Reflex.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo in munere ita se tractavit, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>has so conducted himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ita me in re publicā tractabo, ut meminerim, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 12, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48659.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48659.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To treat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">use</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">conduct one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self towards</hi> a person in any manner: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te, ut merita es de me, tractare exsequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: haec arte tractabat virum, <cb n="TRAC" /> ut, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 125</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus rebus eum ita tractes, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tractabo ut consulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem liberaliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec liberalius nec honorificentius potuisse tractari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater parum pie tractatus a filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercatores ac navicularii injuriosius tractati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauloque benignius ipsum Te tractare voles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 12</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48659.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To handle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discuss</hi> any thing, mentally, orally, or in writing (cf.: dissero, disputo, ago). ( <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> ) With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ad modum quamque causam tractare conveniat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratori omnia quaesita, audita, lecta, disputata, tractata, agitata esse debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habeat omnes philosophiae notos et tractatos locos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:33:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 33, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractata res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">definitiones fortitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:24:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 24, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem philosophiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constantiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi consilia decem legatorum tractabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama fuit ... tractatas inter Eumenen et Persea condiciones amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrupulosius tractabo ventos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 46, 45, § 118</bibl></cit>: prima elementa, Quint. prooem. 21; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 1, 23: locus, qui copississime a Cicerone tractatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 2, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid memori pectore,</quote> <trans><tr>to ponder</tr>, <tr>reflect upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:28" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tractare proeliorum vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: ut quaestio diligentius tractaretur, Aug. Civ. Dei, 2, 21, 1.—</sense><sense id="n48659.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (mostly postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">de officii parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 1</bibl></cit> (9), 20 (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">Madv. and Kiessl. partem): quoniam de religionibus tractabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi de figuris orationis tractandum erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:14" default="NO">2, 13, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:10" default="NO">2, 20, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de negotiis,</quote> <trans><tr>to discuss</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n48659.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo tractatur amicus an inimicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:56" default="NO">7, 2, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utra sit antiquior (lex),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tractaret, quinam adipisci principem locum abnuerent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48659.11" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To negotiate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum de condicionibus tractat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Asiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 37, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de redimendo filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:7:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tractogalatus: <entryFree id="n48660" type="greek" key="tracto^ga^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tractŏgălātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vox hibrida, from tractum and <foreign lang="greek">ga/la</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n48660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cooked with pastry and milk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pultes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. tractomelitus.</sense></entryFree>
tractomelitus: <entryFree id="n48661" type="greek" key="tracto^me^li^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tractŏmĕlĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vox hibrida, from tractum and <foreign lang="greek">me/li</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n48661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cooked with pastry and honey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. the preced. art.</sense></entryFree>
tractorius: <entryFree id="n48662" type="main" key="tracto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tractōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>traho</etym>. <sense id="n48662.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for drawing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hoisting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus machinarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48662.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tractō-rĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. epistula), <hi rend="ital">a letter of invitation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">summons</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 217" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 217</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48662.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">trac-tōrĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. litterae), <hi rend="ital">an imperial letter containing an order to provide a person with necessaries on his journey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tractoriis et stativis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 15, 52</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tractum: <entryFree id="n48663" type="main" key="tractum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tractum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. <itype>traho</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> B.</entryFree>
tractuosus: <entryFree id="n48664" type="main" key="tractu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tractŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>traho</etym>, <sense id="n48664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that draws to itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clammy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gluey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">viscous</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sudor crassus et tractuosus atque viscosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:32:section=167" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 32, § 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
tractus: <entryFree id="n48665" type="main" key="tractus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of traho.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48666" type="main" key="tractus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tractus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>traho</etym>, <sense id="n48666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dragging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hauling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pulling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drawing out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trailing.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48666.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tractu gementem Ferre rotam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractu taurea terga domant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:359" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modicus tractus (al. tractatus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 46, 70, § 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut si qua incerto fallet te littera tractu,</quote> <trans><tr>stroke</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">continuus subitarum tractus aquarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a drinking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 368</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra pestiferum tractu,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>a drawing in</tr>, <tr>inhalation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repetitaque longo Vellera mollibat nebulis aequantia tractu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: harenam fluctus trahunt ... Syrtes ab tractu nominatae, i. e. from Gr. <foreign lang="greek">su/rw,</foreign> = traho; <cit><quote lang="la">because of this drawing,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 78:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 78, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(risus) interdum quodam etiam corporis tractu lacessitur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>movement</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—Of a serpent, <hi rend="ital">a drawing</hi> itself along, <hi rend="ital">a creeping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crawling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">squameus in spiram tractu se colligit anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 725</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> II. Cons. Stil. 172</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n48666.2" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a train</hi>, <hi rend="ital">track</hi>, <hi rend="ital">course</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne vides longos flammarum ducere tractus,</quote> <trans><tr>long trains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 207</bibl></cit>: flammarum, Verg. <cb n="TRAD" /> G. 1, 367; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 270</bibl>: (Phaëthon) longo per aëra tractu Fertur, <hi rend="ital">in a long train</hi> (of fire), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 320</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longo per multa volumina tractu Aestuat unda minax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 565</bibl></cit>; so of the <hi rend="ital">course</hi> of the moon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 46, 97</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the Nile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cydnus) leni tractu e fontibus labens puro solo excipitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut arborum tractu equitatus hostium impediretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the wind,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:614" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 614</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 532</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 366</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48666.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, a space drawn out, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a stretch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tract</hi> of a thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">castrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (urbis) is est tractus ductusque muri, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit> Moser <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mediae jaceant immensis tractibus Alpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 630</bibl></cit>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 9</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48666.4" n="2" level="3"> Concr., of places, <hi rend="ital">a territory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">district</hi>, <hi rend="ital">region</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tract of land</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: regio, plaga): oppidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corruptus caeli tractus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 138</bibl></cit> Serv.: <cit><quote lang="la">tractus ille celeberrimus Venafranus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractus uter plures lepores, uter educet apros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractu surgens oleaster eodem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genera (vitium) separari ac singulis conseri tractibus, utilissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 187</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:15:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 15, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48666.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48666.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">movement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractus orationis lenis et aequabilis,</quote> <trans><tr>course</tr>, <tr>movement</tr>, <tr>current</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in omni corpore, totoque, ut ita dixerim, tractu (orationis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera continuo magis orationis tractu decurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:8:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48666.7" n="2" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">space</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lapse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">period</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod neque clara suo percurrere fulmina cursu Perpetuo possint aevi labentia tractu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1004" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1004</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1216" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1216</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem tractu temporum nituerunt oratores, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:9:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:13" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 13</bibl></cit>, ext. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc legatum Cum voluerit, tractum habet, quamdiu vivat is, a quo, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>duration</tr>, <tr>period</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 11</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48666.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a drawing out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protracting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lengthening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protraction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">length</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta haesitatio tractusque verborum!</quote> <trans><tr>drawling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:50:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 50, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pares elocutionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:118" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (historia) tractu et suavitate atque etiam dulcedine placet,</quote> <trans><tr>extent</tr>, <tr>copiousness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48666.9" n="2" level="3"> Of time: <cit><quote lang="la">durante tractu et lentitudine mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48666.10" n="3" level="3"> In gram.: <cit><quote lang="la">in tractu et declinatione talia sunt, qualia apud Ciceronem beatitas et beatitudo,</quote> <trans><tr>a lengthening in derivation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 32</bibl></cit> Spald.</sense></entryFree>
traditio: <entryFree id="n48667" type="main" key="tra_di^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trādĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>trado</etym>, <sense id="n48667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giving up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delivering up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrender</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. period). </sense><sense id="n48667.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48667.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Gomphorum (urbis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jugurthae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 1, 4, § 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:14:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 14, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48667.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., law t. t., <hi rend="ital">livery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a delivery of possession</hi>: abalienatio est ejus rei quae mancipi est traditio alteri nexu, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:5:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 5, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuda traditione alienare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:19 al" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 19 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n48667.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48667.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A teaching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instruction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejuna atque arida traditio (praeceptorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo non est infinito spatio ac traditione opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48667.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A saying handed down from former times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tradition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incomperta et vulgaria traditio rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:5:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22:14" default="NO">13, 22, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">codicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Bapt. 7:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Bapt. 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—Esp., in eccl. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">traditio seniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
traditor: <entryFree id="n48668" type="main" key="tra_di^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trādĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id</etym> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n48668.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A betrayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traitor</hi>, for the usual proditor: <cit><quote lang="la">interfecto traditore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Carm. 5, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Bapt. 7:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Bapt. 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48668.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A teacher</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus scientiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Coron. Mil. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
traditus: <entryFree id="n48669" type="main" key="tra_di^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trādĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of trado.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48670" type="main" key="tra_di^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trādĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tradition</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">accepisse veteri traditu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 1:31" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 1, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trado: <entryFree id="n48671" type="main" key="tra_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trādo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">transdo</orth>, C. I. L. 1, 198, 54 and 58; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 2</bibl>, and most freq. in Cæs.; <sense id="n48671.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; cf. Neue, Formenl. 2, 734), dĭdi, dĭtum, 3 (in tmesi: transque dato endoque plorato, i. e. tradito et implorato, Vet. Lex ap. Fest. s. v. sub vos, p. 309 Müll.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>trans-do</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hand over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transmit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consign</hi> (syn.: dedo, remitto). </sense><sense id="n48671.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48671.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n48671.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Form trado: <cit><quote lang="la">ut amico traderem (thesaurum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi trade istuc (argentum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 15</bibl>: aliquid<pb n="1884" /> <cb n="TRAD" />  in manum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poculum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedem Castoris sartam tectam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:50:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 50, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistris traditi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam regiam quaestoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueros magistris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos domitoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum tibi legendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ademptus Hector Tradidit fessis leviora tolli Pergama Graiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserat ad legatum Romanum, traditurum se urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis traditis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides, arma, perfugae traditi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: hunc ad carnificem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pistrinum tradier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in custodiam vel in pistrinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:4:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 4, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem supplicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augustus filiam suam equiti Romano tradere meditatus est,</quote> <trans><tr>to give in marriage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">acc. of place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae in Insulā erat Achradinam tradita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 23, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48671.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Form transdo: tot tropaea transdes, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 517, 26</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 366 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">navem in fugam transdunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 155, 8</bibl></cit> (Trag. Rel. v. 630 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut arma per manus necessario transderentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per manus sevi ac picis transditas glebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:15" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi captivos transdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque se hostibus transdiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (alicui),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:43" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se adversariis ad supplicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48671.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48671.6" n="1" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to deliver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confide</hi> for shelter, protection, imprisonment, etc. (syn.: commendo, committo). </sense><sense id="n48671.7" n="(a)" level="5"> Form trado: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ei te commendavi et tradidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum denique hominem tibi ita trado de manu, ut aiunt, in manum tuam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui se laudare et tradere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc hominem velles si tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos (obsides) Aeduis custodiendos tradit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 22, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenis ligatus traditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 45, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tuam custodiam meque et meas spes trado,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48671.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Form transdo: <cit><quote lang="la">ab illo transditum initio et commendatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi a Divitiaco transditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 39</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48671.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To give up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">surrender treacherously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to betray</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam tradere advorsariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos tradituros sperabas, vides judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi trado patriosque meosque Penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferisne paret populandas tradere terras?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:249" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tradimur, heu!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 2, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Judas ausus magistrum tradere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 2, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48671.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48671.11" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to give up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hand over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intrust</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n48671.12" n="(a)" level="5"> Form trado: <cit><quote lang="la">et meam partem loquendi et tuam trado tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo ego, quae mandata, amicus amicis tradam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae dicam trade memoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:10:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 10, 10</bibl></cit> (different from tradere memoriae, B. 2. b.): <cit><quote lang="la">si liberam possessionem Galliae sibi tradidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cingetorigi principatus atque imperium est traditum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristitiam et metus Tradam protervis in mare Creticum Portare ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 26, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48671.13" n="(b)" level="5"> Form transdo: <cit><quote lang="la">summa imperii transditur Camulogeno Aulerco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vergasillauno Arverno summa imperii transditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48671.14" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48671.15" n="1" level="3"> Pregn., with se, <hi rend="ital">to give one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrender</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">devote one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self to</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">se totos voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se quieti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 29, 61</bibl></cit>: se lacrimis ac tristitiae, Luccei. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se studiis vel otio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si se consiliis ejus (rex) tradidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:8:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in studium aliquod quietum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in disciplinam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationibus suis traditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48671.16" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transmit</hi>, as an inheritance; <hi rend="ital">to leave behind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bequeath</hi> (syn. lēgo): <cit><quote lang="la">qui in morte regnum Hieroni tradidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 59</bibl></cit>: inimicitias posteris, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl>, A, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo a majoribus tradita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:72:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 72, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi per successiones traduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: traduntque metus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:32" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">traditumque inde fertur, ut in senatum vocarentur,</quote> <trans><tr>it is said that this was the origin of the custom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48671.17" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To hand down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">transmit to posterity</hi> by written communication; <hi rend="ital">to relate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">narrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recount</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum nomina multi poëtae memoriae tradiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: pugnae<cb n="TRAD" />  memoriam posteris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 10, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (Socratis) ingenium variosque sermones immortalitati scriptis suis Plato tradidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:16:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 16, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualia permulta historia tradidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:53:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 53, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid posteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tradit Fabius Pictor in Annalibus suis, hirundinem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 24, 34, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum regem tradunt ... operatum his sacris se abdidisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 31, 8</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">pass. pers.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is said</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is recorded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">they say</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Aristides) unus omnium justissimus fuisse traditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:67:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 67, 141</bibl></cit>: cujus (Lycurgi) temporibus Homerus etiam fuisse traditur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec traditur certum, nec interpretatio est facilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 28, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic enim est traditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc posteris memoriae traditum iri, Aequos et Volscos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 67, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galbam, Africanum, Laelium doctos fuisse traditum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Isocratem dixisse traditum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:56:204" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 56, 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguenta quis primus invenerit, non traditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de hoc constantius traditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: traditur memoriae, with <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 21, 16</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48671.18" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To deliver</hi> by teaching; <hi rend="ital">to propose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teach</hi> any thing (syn. praecipio). </sense><sense id="n48671.19" n="(a)" level="5"> Form trado: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae dialectici nunc tradunt et docent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elementa loquendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:18:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 18, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimarum artium vias meis civibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid artificio et viă,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec subtilius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem hominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem tempore tradi omnia et percipi possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamquam tradita sed tamquam innata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 40:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 40, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua est in his culpa, tradentis (i.e. magistri) est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48671.20" n="(b)" level="5"> Form transdo: <cit><quote lang="la">multa praeterea de sideribus atque eorum motu ... disputant et juventuti transdunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minervam operum atque artificiorum initia transdere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48671.21" n="4" level="3"> Aliquid oblivioni, <hi rend="ital">to forget utterly</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes justitiae ejus oblivioni tradentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:33:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 33, 13</bibl></cit>; Greg. Mag. in Job, 25, 8.</sense></entryFree>
traducianus: <entryFree id="n48672" type="main" key="tra_du_ci^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trādūcĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. q. tradux, II. (late Lat.): traducianum creditur esse peccatum, Jul. Pelag. ap. Mar. Merc. Subnot. 7, 2.</entryFree>
traduco: <entryFree id="n48673" type="main" key="tra_du_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trādūco</orth> (TRANSDVCO, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 750</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 42, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 37, 1</bibl>; and so always in Cæs.; v. Neue, Formenl. 1, 734), xi, ctum, 3 (<sense id="n48673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imv.</hi> traduce, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 12</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> sync. traduxti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 16</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> parag. transducier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 46</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>trans-duco</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">conduct across; to lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">carry over</hi> any thing (syn. traicio). </sense><sense id="n48673.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48673.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">jamne hanc traduxti huc ad nos vicinam tuam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut traduxisti huc ad nos uxorem tuam!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">traduce et matrem et familiam omnem ad nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum ex Galliā in Ligures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suas copias per angustias et fines Sequanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias praeter castra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes ad se in castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimenta ad se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regem Antiochum in Europam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquaeductum per domum suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:2:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua pompa Eo traducenda est,</quote> <trans><tr>to be carried over to him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 18</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">victimas in triumpho,</quote> <trans><tr>parade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:39:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 39, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carpentum, quo in pompā traduceretur,</quote> <trans><tr>was borne along</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">trans</hi> (rare, and only when the place to which is also expressed): <cit><quote lang="la">hominum multitudinem trans Rhenum in Galliam transducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 35</bibl></cit> Kraner ad loc.—With <case>abl.</case> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">legiones Peninis Cottianisque Alpibus traducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 68</bibl></cit>.—With double <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">traductus exercitus silvam Ciminiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 39, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. in the foll. B.—</sense><sense id="n48673.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48673.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">convey across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to transport over</hi> a stream or bridge: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen subito accrevit, ut eā re traduci non potuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:31:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 31, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem in Arari faciundum curat. atque ita exercitum transducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl></cit>. — Freq. with a double <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: cum Isaram flumen exercitum traduxissem, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10</bibl>. 21, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Caesar certior factus est, tres jam copiarum partes Helvetios id flumen transduxisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: flumen Axonam exercitum transducere,<cb n="TRAD" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos Caesar transduxerat Rhenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:13" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:7:11" default="NO">7, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 23, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 45, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volturnum flumen exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 36, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum exercitum traducite Iberum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 41, 23</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptim traducto exercitu Iberum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 41, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 39, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio flumen transducta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 57</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">ne major multitudo Germanorum Rhenum transducatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 76</bibl>. — With <case>abl.</case> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nisi flumine Ligeri copias traduxisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:27" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Belgas Rhenum antiquitus esse transductos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48673.5" n="2" level="3"> Publicists' t. t.: traducere equum, <hi rend="ital">to lead his horse along</hi>, said of a knight who passed muster at the inspection by the censor (cf. transveho): <cit><quote lang="la">qui (P. Africanus) cum esset censor et in equitum censu C.
