Licinius Sacerdos prodisset ... cum contra nemo diceret, jussit equum traducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:48:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 48, 134</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48673.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lead along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parade</hi> in public by way of disgrace: <cit><quote lang="la">delatores flagellis caesi ac traducti per amphitheatri harenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. infra, II. B. 2.</sense><sense id="n48673.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48673.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">carry over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to transfer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut alio possis animi traducere motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1068" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1068</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos judicum a severitate paulisper ad hilaritatem risumque traducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:93:322" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 93, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum hominis ab omni aliā cogitatione ad tuam dignitatem tuendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos a contrariā defensione abducere et ad nostram conor traducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:72:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 72, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad amicitiam consuetudinemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post partum cura in vitulos traducitur omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum omnem orationem traduxi et converti in increpandam Caepionis fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:48:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 48, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc rationem naturae difficile est traducere ad id genus divinationis,</quote> <trans><tr>to apply</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 57, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen eorum ad errorem fabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">centuriones ex inferioribus ordinibus in superiores ordines erant transducti,</quote> <trans><tr>transferred</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is ad plebem P. Clodium traducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Clodium a patribus ad plebem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>: academicen <foreign lang="greek">su/ntacin,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens in patricias transducta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augur destinatus ad pontificatum traductus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicus aegrum in meliorem consuetudinem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 11</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (oratio) eos qui audient ad majorem admirationem possit traducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:192" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 57, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mali punientur et traducentur in melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:13:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 13, 4</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me mea paupertas vitae traducat inerti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit> (where Müll. reads vita).—</sense><sense id="n48673.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48673.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw over</hi> one to some side or opinion: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem traducere ad optimates paro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si istud obtinueris, traducas me ad te totum licebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4</bibl></cit>. 1, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">transductis ad se jam pluribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">traduxit me ad suam sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:52:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 52, 144</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48673.11" n="2" level="3"> To lead along, exhibit as a spectacle, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make a show of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to expose to public ridicule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">degrade</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">an non sensistis ... vestras conjuges, vestros liberos traductos per ora hominum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 38, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36</bibl>. 1, 5; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rideris multoque magis traduceris, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:77:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 77, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 100:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 100, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:17:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 2, 17, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:4:32:3" default="NO">4, 32, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:74:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 74, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:17" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tua traducit manifesto carmina furto,</quote> <trans><tr>convicts of</tr>, <tr>proves guilty of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:53:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 53, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48673.12" n="3" level="3"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">to set forth publicly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhibit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread abroad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëmata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot annorum secreta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17</bibl></cit>: se, <hi rend="ital">to show one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self in public</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lorica, in quā se traducebat Ulixem ancipitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:31" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 31</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48673.13" n="4" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: ago, transigo): otiosam aetatem et quietam sine ullo labore et contentione traducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 82</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quod datum est vitae tranquille placideque traducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:11:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: quantumcumque superest temporis, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentiam eleganter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tempus quā ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus artibus latebrisque, vitam per novem annos, Tac H. 4, 67: leniter aevum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 97</bibl></cit>: tempora Cynicā cenā, Petr. poët. 14: consul traducere noctem exsomnis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:4" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 4</bibl> et saep.—Hence, transf., of the administration of an office: <cit><quote lang="la">munus summā modestiā et summā abstinentiă,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48673.14" n="5" level="3"> In later gram. lang. <pb n="1885" /> <cb n="TRAG" /> </sense><sense id="n48673.15" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To transfer</hi> a word from one subject or from one language to another (for the class. verto, converto, reddo, transfero, etc.): videtur Graecos secutus, qui <foreign lang="greek">e)fo/dion</foreign> a sumptu viae ad aliarum quoque rerum apparatus traducunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocabulum Graecum in linguam Romanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:18:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48673.16" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To derive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactare multo fusius largiusque est quam jacere, unde id verbum traductum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
traductio: <entryFree id="n48674" type="main" key="tra_ducti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāductĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>traduco</etym>. * <sense id="n48674.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a leading along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conducting</hi> in triumph: <cit><quote lang="la">traductio captorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48674.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48674.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (acc. to traduco, II. A.), <hi rend="ital">a removing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transferring</hi> from one rank to another: <cit><quote lang="la">traductio ad plebem furibundi hominis ac perditi (Clodii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 7, 15</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48674.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48674.4" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to traduco, II. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">A making a show of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exposure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public disgrace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic damnatum cum dedecore et traductione vita exigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:6:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogationes ad traductionem nostram excogitatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 85, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 2, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 16, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epit. 45, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48674.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A leading in triumph</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48674.6" n="3" level="3"> (Acc. to traduco, II. B. 4.) Of time, <hi rend="ital">the passage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lapse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">course</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:56:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 56, 127</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48674.7" n="4" level="3"> (Acc. to traduco, II. B. 5.) In rhet. </sense><sense id="n48674.8" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A transferring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">metonymy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">traductio atque immutatio in verbo: Africa terribili tremit horrida terra tumultu. Pro Afris est sumpta Africa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:42:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 42, 167</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48674.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A repetition</hi> of the same word, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 14, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
traductor: <entryFree id="n48675" type="main" key="tra_ductor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāductor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the conveyer</hi>, a nickname of Pompey, who transferred Clodius from a patrician to a plebeian gens: <cit><quote lang="la">traductor ad plebem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
traductus: <entryFree id="n48676" type="main" key="tra_ductus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of traduco.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48677" type="hapax" key="tra_ductus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāductus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>traduco</etym>, <sense id="n48677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a passage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium per eos traductus agentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 8, 2</bibl></cit> dub. (al. tractus).</sense></entryFree>
tradux: <entryFree id="n48678" type="main" key="tra_dux"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trādux</orth>, <itype>ŭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>traduco, what is led or brought over; hence</etym>, in econom. lang., <sense id="n48678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vine-branch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vine-layer</hi> trained for propagation. </sense><sense id="n48678.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:7:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 7, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:13" default="NO">4, 29, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n48678.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne traduce carnis transfundi in subolem credatur fons animarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 983</bibl></cit>.—In appos., with materia: traduce materiā, Sev. Aetn. 566.</sense></entryFree>
tragacantha: <entryFree id="n48679" type="greek" key="tra^ga^cantha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgăcantha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">traga/kanqa,</foreign> <sense id="n48679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">goat</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-thorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tragacanth-bush</hi>: Astragalus tragacantha, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 21, 36, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:140" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 14, 87, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:78" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 9, 23, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tragacanthum: <entryFree id="n48680" type="main" key="tra^ga^canthum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgăcanthum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tragacantha</etym>, <sense id="n48680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gum-tragacanth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 78" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:108" default="NO">108</bibl>.—Called also, in a corrupted form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">drăgantum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 32</bibl>; Theod. Prisc. de Diaeta, 9.</sense></entryFree>
traganthes: <entryFree id="n48681" type="greek" key="tra^ganthes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăganthes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">traga/nqhs,</foreign> <sense id="n48681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of the plant</hi> artemisia, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
traganus: <entryFree id="n48682" type="greek" key="tra^ga^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tra/ganos,</foreign> i. q. <foreign lang="greek">tra/gos,</foreign> <sense id="n48682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sucking-pig dressed in a particular way</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tragasaeus: <entryFree id="n48683" type="main" key="Tragasaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tragasaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n48683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the town Tragasa in Troas</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:85 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 41, § 85 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tragelaphus: <entryFree id="n48684" type="greek" key="tra^ge^la^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgĕlăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trage/lafos,</foreign> <sense id="n48684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of stag with a beard like a goat</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the horse-stag</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 33, 50, § 120</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 14, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tragemata: <entryFree id="n48685" type="greek" key="tra^ge_ma^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgēmăta</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tragh/mata,</foreign> fruits, etc., eaten as an after-course, <sense id="n48685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dessert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweetmeats</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confectionery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 5, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tragematia: <entryFree id="n48686" type="main" key="tra^ge_ma^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgēmătĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">traghma/tia,</foreign> <sense id="n48686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweetmeats</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confectionery</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Reg. S. Pach. 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tragice: <entryFree id="n48687" type="main" key="tra^gi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tragicus <sense id="n48687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tragicocomoedia: <entryFree id="n48688" type="greek" key="tra^gi^co^co_moedi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgĭcŏcōmoedĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tragikokwmw|di/a,</foreign> <sense id="n48688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drama composed of a mixture of tragedy and comedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tragi-comedy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 59</bibl> and 63.</sense></entryFree>
tragicus: <entryFree id="n48689" type="greek" key="tra^gi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tragiko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n48689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to tragedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tragic.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48689.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48689.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>tragedy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Camena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cothurni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 5, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus scaenarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actor,</quote> <trans><tr>a tragic actor</tr>, <tr>tragedian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orestes aut Athamas,</quote> <trans><tr>represented in tragedy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 20, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cerva,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in the tragedy of Iphigenia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:120" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 120</bibl></cit>: tragicum illud <cb n="TRAG" /> subinde jactabat: <cit><quote lang="la">oderint dum metuant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48689.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a tragic poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">writer of tragedy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:14" default="NO">9, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n48689.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A tragedian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tragic actor; plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48689.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48689.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In the tragic style</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tragic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lofty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sublime</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit Sulpicius vel maxime omnium grandis et, ut ita dicam, tragicus orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:55:203" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 55, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec tragica atque divina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:56:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 56, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:18:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam spirat tragicum satis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 166</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48689.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of a tragic nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tragic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horrible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fearful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res tragicas paene comice, tristes remisse tractavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tulit et Romana regia sceleris tragici exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concubitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes (i. e. amores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:407" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Erinnyes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit> (3, 13), 29: <cit><quote lang="la">asperitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:8:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a tragic manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tragically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem rhetorice et tragice ornare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 11, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 100:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 100, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tragion: <entryFree id="n48690" type="greek" key="tra^gi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tra/gion,</foreign> <sense id="n48690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">goatwort</hi>, a plant so called, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 21, 36, § 115</bibl>.— Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgŏnis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 115, § 141</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tragoedia: <entryFree id="n48691" type="greek" key="tra^goedi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgoedĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tragw|di/a,</foreign> <sense id="n48691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tragedy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48691.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:6" default="NO">1, 8, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48691.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48691.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Tragedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the art of tragedy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulum Musa Tragoediae Desit theatris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:381" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 381</bibl>.—Personified: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenti Tragoedia passu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48691.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A lofty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">elevated style</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque istis tragoediis tuis ... perturbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 219</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55, 225</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48691.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A great commotion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disturbance; a spectacle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus Appiae nomen quantas tragoedias excitat!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tragoedias agamus in nugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 51, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in parvis litibus tragoedias movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tragoediographus: <entryFree id="n48692" type="greek" key="tra^goedi^o_^gra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgoedĭō^grăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tragw|dio/grafos,</foreign> <sense id="n48692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a writer of tragedies</hi>, Schol. Cruq. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 42</bibl>; cf. Philarg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 10</bibl>; Mar. Vict. p. 2532 P.</sense></entryFree>
tragoedus: <entryFree id="n48693" type="greek" key="tra^goedus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgoedus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tragw|do/s.</foreign> <sense id="n48693.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tragic actor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 129</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n48693.1" n="II" level="1"> Tragoedus, <hi rend="ital">an epithet of Jupiter</hi>, derived from the Vicus Tragoedus at Rome, in the Regio Esquilina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 57</bibl>; Sext. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> Reg. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tragonis: <entryFree id="n48694" type="main" key="tra^go^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgŏnis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. tragion.</entryFree>
tragopan: <entryFree id="n48695" type="greek" key="tra^go^pa_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgŏpān</orth>, <itype>ānis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">trago/pan</foreign> (analog. to <foreign lang="greek">aigi/pan</foreign>), <sense id="n48695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabulous bird</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the bearded vulture</hi>: Vultur barbatus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 49, 70, § 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:9:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tragopogon: <entryFree id="n48696" type="greek" key="tra^go^po_go_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgŏpōgōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tragopw/gwn,</foreign> <sense id="n48696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goat</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-beard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 117, § 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:89" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 15, 52, § 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tragoriganum: <entryFree id="n48697" type="greek" key="tra^go^ri_ga^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgŏrīgănum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tragopi/ganon,</foreign> <sense id="n48697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">goat</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-thyme</hi>: Thymus tragoriganum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 68, § 176</bibl>. — Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgŏrīgănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tragos: <entryFree id="n48698" type="greek" key="tra^go^s1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tra/gos</foreign> (a goat). <sense id="n48698.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of thorny plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 21, 37, § 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:142" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 13, 116, § 142</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48698.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of sponge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 45, 69, § 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:123" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 11, 47, § 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n48699" type="main" key="tra_go^s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāgŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. tragum.</entryFree>
tragula: <entryFree id="n48700" type="main" key="tra_gu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāgŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>traho</etym>. <sense id="n48700.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of javelin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dart</hi> attached to a strap by which it was swung when thrown, Lucil. ap. Fest. s. v. spara, pp. 330 and 331 Müll.; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 553, 31</bibl>, and 555, 22; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 57</bibl>; Liv 21, 7, 10; 24, 42, 2; Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 553, 29</bibl>; Auct. B. Hisp. 32, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:318" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 318</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=115" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 115</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=367" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 367</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:6:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 6, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48700.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a snare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plot</hi> (Plautinian): <cit><quote lang="la">tragulam in te inicere adornat: nescio quam fabricam facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volui inicere tragulam in nostrum senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48700.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of dragnet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 8, 13, § 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48700.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small</hi> traha or <hi rend="ital">sledge</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=139" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 139</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
tragularius: <entryFree id="n48701" type="main" key="tra_gu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāgŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tragula, I.</etym>, <sense id="n48701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soldier who placed and levelled the</hi> tragulae <hi rend="ital">to be discharged from an engine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tragum: <entryFree id="n48702" type="main" key="tra_gum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāgum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n48702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of pap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">porridge</hi>, Phn. 18, 7, 16, § 76; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 20</bibl>.— Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">trāgŏs</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 20, § 93</bibl>. <cb n="TRAH" /></sense></entryFree>
tragurium: <entryFree id="n48703" type="main" key="Tragurium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tragurium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n48703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Dalmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48703.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island in the Adriatic Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tragus: <entryFree id="n48704" type="greek" key="tra^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tra/gos</foreign> (a goat). <sense id="n48704.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The goatlike smell of the armpits</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:22:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 22, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48704.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:112" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 54, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
traha: <entryFree id="n48705" type="main" key="tra^ha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>traho</etym>, a vehicle without wheels, <sense id="n48705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sledge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:20:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 20, 3</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">trăhĕa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
traharius: <entryFree id="n48706" type="hapax" key="tra^ha_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăhārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>traha</etym>, <sense id="n48706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who draws a</hi> traha, <hi rend="ital">a sledge-man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baggage-man</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trahax: <entryFree id="n48707" type="hapax" key="tra^hax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăhax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>traho</etym>, <sense id="n48707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that draws every thing to himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covetous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">procax, rapax, trahax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trahea: <entryFree id="n48708" type="main" key="tra^he^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăhĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. traha.</entryFree>
traho: <entryFree id="n48709" type="main" key="tra^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trăho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n48709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. perf.</hi> sync. traxe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:786" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 786</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. Sanscr. trankh, trakh, to move; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tre/xw,</foreign> to run</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drag</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">haul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drag along; to draw off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forth</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>, etc. (syn.: tracto, rapio, rapto, duco). </sense><sense id="n48709.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48709.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Amphitruonem collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum a custodibus in fugā trinis catenis vinctus traheretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trahebatur passis Priameïa virgo Crinibus a templo Cassandra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus tractum et laniatum abjecit in mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam (malagmata),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 22, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vapor porro trahit aëra secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limum harenamque et saxa ingentia fluctus trahunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 78:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 78, 3</bibl></cit>: Charybdis naves ad litora trahit, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 425</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Scyllam naves in saxa trahentem, Verg. l. l.: (haematiten) trahere in se argentum, aes, ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 20, 38, § 146</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Gy.</hi> Amiculum hoc sustolle saltem. <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Sine trahi, cum egomet trahor, <hi rend="ital">let it drag</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 117</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tragula ab eo, quod trahitur per terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=139" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 139</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">sarcinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 44:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 44, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem per pulpita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaustra per altos montes cervice (boves),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siccas machinae carinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genua aegra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trahantur per me pedibus omnes rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 32, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad praetorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitem in pistrinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hectorem circum sua Pergama,</quote> <trans><tr>to drag</tr>, <tr>trail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 591</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of a train of soldiers, attendants, etc.: Scipio gravem jam spoliis multarum urbium exercitum trahens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentem secum occurrentium prosequentiumque trahentes turbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 3, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra manu victosque deos parvumque nepotem Ipse trahit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secum legionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:20" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminae pleraeque parvos trahentes liberos, ibant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:5:15" default="NO">5, 5, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor, quam comitem trahebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folium secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum privato comitatu quem semper secum trahere moris fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:40:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 40, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam manum Thracum secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:112:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 112, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48709.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48709.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To draw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pull out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trahens haerentia viscere tela,</quote> <trans><tr>drawing out</tr>, <tr>extracting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum e vulnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e corpore ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:399" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de corpore telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium de visceribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:14:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu lignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 371</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">te quoque, Luna, traho (i. e. de caelo),</quote> <trans><tr>draw down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:207" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captum Jovem Caelo trahit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oct. 810" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oct. 810</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48709.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To draw together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrinkle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at coria et carnem trahit et conducit in unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:968" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 968</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in manibus vero nervi trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum rugasque coëgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48709.6" n="3" level="3"> Of fluids, etc., <hi rend="ital">to draw in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quaff; draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw up</hi>: si pocula arente fauce traxerim, <hi rend="ital">had drawn in</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">quaffed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:4" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 14, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 330</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:822" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 822</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venena ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:934" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 934</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:351 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 351 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex puteis jugibus aquam calidam trahi (videmus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 25</bibl></cit>: navigium aquam trahit, <hi rend="ital">draws</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lets in water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leaks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:10:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 10, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem jumento de cervice,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw</tr>, <tr>let</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 43</bibl></cit>.—Of smelling: <cit><quote lang="la">odorem naribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">drawing in</hi> the breath, <hi rend="ital">inhaling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auras ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 3, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Servilius exiguā in spe trahebat animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritum,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw breath</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:43:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 43, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 10</bibl>: spiritum extremum,<pb n="1886" /> <cb n="TRAH" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 21, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus suspiria,</quote> <trans><tr>to heave sighs</tr>, <tr>to sigh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:753" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 753</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem imo a pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 371</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48709.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iris Mille trahens varios adverso sole colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 701</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">squamam cutis durata trahebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 675</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:236" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 236</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">14, 393: ruborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:482" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 482</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 595: calorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:305" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidis figuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:399" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robiginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 18, 30, § 136</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48709.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To drag away violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carry off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunder</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/gein kai\ fe/rein</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera rape, trahe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapere omnes, trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus non humana ulla neque divina obstant, quin ... in opes potentisque trahant exscindant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 61, 17</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi quisque ducere, trahere, rapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 41, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquo trahere spolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:23:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 23, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam ex agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum jam praedae hostes trahere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pastor cum traheret per freta navibus Idaeis Helenen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48709.9" n="6" level="3"> Trahere pecuniam (for distrahere), <hi rend="ital">to make away with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dissipate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squander</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus modis pecuniam trahunt, vexant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48709.10" n="7" level="3"> Of drugs, etc., <hi rend="ital">to purge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rcmove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilem ex alvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 22, § 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 42, § 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pituitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 23, 94, § 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruditates, pituitas, bilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 9, 31, § 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48709.11" n="8" level="3"> Trahere lanam, vellera, etc., <hi rend="ital">to draw out</hi> lengthwise, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to spin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manufacture</hi>: manibus trahere lanam, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 545, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:54" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera digitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">data pensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:511" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 511</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laconicas purpuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48709.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, </sense><sense id="n48709.13" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n48709.14" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw along; to attract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">influence</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">trahimur omnes studio laudis et optimus quisque maxime gloriā ducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 11, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes trahimur et ducimur ad cognitionis et scientiae cupiditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">allicere delectatione et viribus trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trahit sua quemque voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 65</bibl></cit>: aliquem in aliam partem, <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gain over</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 4, 2</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Drusum in partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem ad regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 44, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in suam sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 25, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: rem ad Poenos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ad Philippum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni ea res longius nos ab incepto traheret,</quote> <trans><tr>draw off</tr>, <tr>divert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48709.15" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To drag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures secum in eandem calamitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucanos ad defectionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo fata trahunt retrahuntque, sequamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 709</bibl></cit>: ducunt volentem fata, nolentem trahunt, Cleanth. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 107:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 107, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48709.16" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To draw to</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set down to</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">atque egomet me adeo cum illis una ibidem traho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 166</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Quid quod dedisti scortis? <hi rend="ital">Le.</hi> Ibidem una traho, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi numero avium regnum trahebant,</quote> <trans><tr>drew to their side</tr>, <tr>laid claim to</tr>, <tr>claimed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui captae decus Nolae ad consulem trahunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 28, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia non bene consulta in virtutem trahebantur,</quote> <trans><tr>were set down to</tr>, <tr>referred</tr>, <tr>attributed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatum ipsius (ducis) in superbiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta Germanici in deterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuita ad culpam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ad clementiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in religionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur abstinuerit spectaculo ipse, varie trahebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in se crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinas Traxit in exemplum,</quote> <trans><tr>adopted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:245" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 245</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48709.17" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To drag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distract</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae meum animum divorse trahunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trahi in aliam partem mente atque animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vologeses diversas ad curas trahebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48709.18" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To weigh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ponder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli atque pacis rationes trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 84:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 84, 4</bibl>: trahere consilium, <hi rend="ital">to form a decision</hi> or <hi rend="ital">determination</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 98:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 98, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48709.19" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">derive</hi>: qui majorem ex pernicie et peste rei publicae molestiam traxerit, <hi rend="ital">who has derived</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">has received</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffered</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cognomen ex contumeliā traxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen e causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 20, 38, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen ab illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">originem ab aliquo,</quote> <trans><tr>to derive</tr>, <tr>deduce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 21, § 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:157" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 28, 32, § 157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio ab isto initio tractum esse sermonem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>has arisen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:6:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: facetiae, quae multum ex vero traxere, <hi rend="ital">drew</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">they were founded</hi> <cb n="TRAI" /> <hi rend="ital">largely on truth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 68</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multum ex moribus (Sarmatarum) traxisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 46, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48709.20" n="7" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to protract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drag out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">linger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">afflictus vitam in tenebris luctuque trahebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 92</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 5, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 2, § 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">traherent cum sera crepuscula noctem,</quote> <trans><tr>was bringing on the night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 219</bibl></cit>: verba, <hi rend="ital">to drag</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to utter with difficulty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:79" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48709.21" n="8" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To draw out</hi>, in respect of time; <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prolong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lengthen; to protract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retard</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prolato, extendo): sin trahitur bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 23, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trahere omnia,</quote> <trans><tr>to interpose delays of all kinds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 36, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 584</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam aliquamdiu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 15, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum hoc naturae Corpus ... manebit incolume, comitem aevi sui laudem Ciceronis trahet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:66:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 66, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidionem in longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem de industriā in serum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 35, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurgiis trahere tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus, Auct. B. Alex. 38, 2: moram ficto languore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:767" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 767</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(legati) querentes, trahi se a Caesare,</quote> <trans><tr>that they were put off</tr>, <tr>delayed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sermone, quousque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marius multis diebus et laboribus consumptis anxius trahere cum animo suo, omitteretne inceptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 93:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 93, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48709.22" n="9" level="3"> Rarely <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drag along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure.</hi> si quis etiam in eo morbo diutius traxit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem annos traxit ista dominatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, drawn on, i. e. <hi rend="ital">proceeding continuously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluent</hi>, of language: <cit><quote lang="la">genus orationis fusum atque tractum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:15:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 15, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his (contione et hortatione) tracta quaedam et fluens expetitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 20, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48709.23" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tractum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">any thing drawn out at length.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48709.24" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A flock of wool</hi> drawn out for spinning: <cit><quote lang="la">tracta de niveo vellere dente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:80" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48709.25" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A long piece of dough</hi> pulled out in making pastry, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 76, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">76, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:3" default="NO">4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:5:1 al" default="NO">5, 1 al.</bibl>—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">tracta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 27, § 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
traicio: <entryFree id="n48710" type="main" key="tra_i^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāĭcĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">transĭcĭo</orth> (so always in Cæs.); also <orth extent="full" lang="la">trājĭcĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">transjĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>jēci, jectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>trans-jacio</etym>, <sense id="n48710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw across.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48710.1" n="I" level="1"> With the person or thing that moves as object, <hi rend="ital">to cause to cross</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to go across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">through.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48710.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hurl</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cast</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fling over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shoot over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">across</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ullum interim telum transiciebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae concava trajecto cumba rudente vehat (te),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arreptum vexillum trans vallum hostium trajecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum trans vallum signum trajecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontibus transjectis,</quote> <trans><tr>thrown across</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:9" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malis antennisque de nave in navem trajectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucrem trajecto in fune columbam suspendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela alio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit> (3, 3), 18: <cit><quote lang="la">pecora nunc in hibernos nunc in aestivos saltus,</quote> <trans><tr>drives over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes super acervos,</quote> <trans><tr>to step over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 76: <cit><quote lang="la">membra per ardentes acervos celeri pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:782" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 782</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48710.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48710.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To transfer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to go over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">across</hi> (from one place, etc., to another): <cit><quote lang="la">est etiam aurigae species Vertumnus et ejus, Traicit alterno qui leve pondus equo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>leaps lightly from horse to horse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 36: <cit><quote lang="la">anulum in dextram manum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est levissimum ac summum, ut traiciant in alia vasa,</quote> <trans><tr>decant</tr>, <tr>pour over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:64:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 64, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerussam in cacabum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 45" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48710.5" n="2" level="3"> Of soldiers, baggage, etc., <hi rend="ital">to cause to cross</hi> (a stream, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to transport</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ship across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lead</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conduct over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ship over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfer</hi>: dum Brutus traiceret exercitum, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones quattuor equitatumque omnem transjecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
