C. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus ferme suis trans Rhodanum trajectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res suas trans Halyn,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 25, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ibi legiones essent, eas ... in Siciliam traiceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut classem in Italiam traiceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam in provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:48:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes">48, 13, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc legionem postea transicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam partem fortunarum eodem trajecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eas (sues) si quo traicere vult, in plostrum imponat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut praedatum milites trans flumen per occasiones aliis atque aliis locis traiceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: Marius trajectus in Africam, Cic. <cb n="TRAJ" /> Red. Quir. 8, 20: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum innumerabilem vim traici Hellesponto in Europam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 48, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis Punica in Sardiniam trajecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(exercitus) Pado trajectus Cremonam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:56:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 56, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 24, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inermes in Boeotiam trajecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Galliam trajecti forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 39</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48710.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With second <case>acc.</case> of the stream or place crossed: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum magnam partem flumen transjecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar Germanos flumen traicit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 83</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si se Alpes Antonius trajecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: exercitum Rhodanum, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias Rhodanum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos in Africam secum traiceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:22:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 22, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48710.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Achillam sese ex regiā trajecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112</bibl></cit>: si quo etiam casu Isaram se trajecerint, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducem Romanum in Africam trajecisse sese in hostilem terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 18, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48710.8" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the eyes: <cit><quote lang="la">quocumque oculos trajecimus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to look</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 424</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48710.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pass through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a way through.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48710.10" n="(a)" level="5"> Of soldiers: <cit><quote lang="la">pars magna equitum mediam trajecit aciem,</quote> <trans><tr>broke through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48710.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To strike through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stab through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transpierce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum ex multitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem scorpione, a latere dextro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lictorem gladio, Auct. B. Alex. 52: cuspide serpentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 571</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanceā infestā medium femur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:48" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femur tragulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cava tempora ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundine linguam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terga sagittā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exuentem se ac nudatum gladio trajecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittā sub mammā trajectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:9:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid acu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 8</bibl></cit> and 9.—With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stab one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se uno ictu infra laevam papillam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48710.12" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48710.13" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to transfer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause to pass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex illius invidiā deonerare aliquid et in te traicere coeperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam in alium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrium litis trajecit in omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 628</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">in cor Trajecto lateris capitisque dolore,</quote> <trans><tr>having thrown itself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48710.14" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in rhet.: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <trans><tr>to transpose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:69:229" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 69, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba in clausulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 31</bibl></cit> Spald.—</sense><sense id="n48710.15" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cross over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cross.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48710.16" n="A" level="2"> With the place or thing passed over as object: <cit><quote lang="la">si Hannibal ad portas venisset murumque jaculo trajecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trajecto amni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hiberum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupavit Scipio Padum traicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 39, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratibus Trebiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:56:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 56, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 31, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 27, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 14:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13:23" default="NO">8, 13, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utribus amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:10" default="NO">4, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:15:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Padum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinum maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:43:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 43, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina nando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberim clipeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aurora Jam medium aetherio cursu trajecerat axem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 536</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam cernant Rhodanum trajectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut transjaci (nemora) ne sagittis quidem possint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48710.17" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Aethaliam insulam trajecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut classe Hasdrubal Aegimurum traiceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 24, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne qua classis ex Africā traiceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed traicere in Euboeam erat propositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ei) paranti traicere in Africam nuntiatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 36, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanae naves Samum traicerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo quoque tempore in Africam traiciendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 22, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad nos trajecturum illud incendium esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 30, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:48:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 48, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscatoriā scaphā trepidus trajecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:13:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trajecisse veteres Iberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 14</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48710.18" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to overstep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transgress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">traicit et fati litora magnus amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:19:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 19, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trajanus: <entryFree id="n48711" type="main" key="Tra_ja_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trājānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Trajan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman emperor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who reigned</hi> A.D. 98-118, <hi rend="ital">proverbial for his justice and benevolence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augusto felicior, Trajano melior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trājānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Trajan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 93" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">VIA,</quote> <trans><tr>the Appian Way</tr>, <tr>restored by Trajan</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 199, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trajecticius: <entryFree id="n48712" type="main" key="tra_jecti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trājectīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>traicio</etym>, <sense id="n48712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is carried over sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transported</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:2:4" default="NO">22, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4:2" default="NO">13, 4, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">44, 7, 22: contractus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 32, 26</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1887" /> <cb n="TRAM" /></sense></entryFree>
trajectio: <entryFree id="n48713" type="main" key="tra_jecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trājectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>traicio</etym>. <sense id="n48713.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a crossing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trajectiones incendiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestior existimatur trajectio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the going over sea to Pompey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: trajectiones motusque stellarum, <hi rend="ital">the shootings over</hi>, i. e., concr., <hi rend="ital">shooting-stars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meteors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">stellae trajectio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48713.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of language. </sense><sense id="n48713.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A transposition</hi> of words, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 32, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:69:230" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 69, 230</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48713.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Exaggeration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hyperbole</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum augendi minuendive causā veritatis superlatio atque trajectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superlatio veritatis et trajectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48713.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A throwing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">putting off upon another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 204</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trajectitius: <entryFree id="n48714" type="main" key="tra_jecti_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trājectītĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. trajecticius.</entryFree>
trajecto: <entryFree id="n48715" type="hapax" key="tra_jecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trājecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>traicio</etym>, <sense id="n48715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pierce through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinum umbilici acu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
trajector: <entryFree id="n48716" type="main" key="tra_jector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trājector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that pierces through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a piercer</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ignis Trajector nebulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 882</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trajectorium: <entryFree id="n48717" type="main" key="tra_jecto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trājectōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a funnel</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
trajectura: <entryFree id="n48718" type="hapax" key="tra_jectu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trājectūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a projecting over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">projection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutulorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
trajectus: <entryFree id="n48719" type="main" key="tra_jectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trājectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of traicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48720" type="main" key="tra_jectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trājectus</orth> (in Cæs. <orth extent="full" lang="la">transjectus</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>traicio</etym>. <sense id="n48720.0" n="I" level="1"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">a crossing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">passing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi> (class., but not in Cic., who uses instead trajectio): <cit><quote lang="la">transjectus in Britanniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in trajectu Albulae amnis submersus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:51:1" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 51, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestate in trajectu bis conflictatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48720.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a place for passing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a passage</hi>: legiones et auxilia mittit ad trajectum, Auct. B. Alex. 56, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tralaticius: <entryFree id="n48721" type="main" key="tra_la_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trālātīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, ūm</itype>, v. translaticius.</entryFree>
tralles: <entryFree id="n48722" type="main" key="Tralles1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tralles</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n48722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Lydia</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Aidin Guzel - Hissar</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 24, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">29, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 15, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:105:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 105, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:70" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 70</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trallis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 108</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trallĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tralles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Trallian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi vero Trallianus fuerit Demosthenes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a native of Tralles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:70:234" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 70, 234</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 6, 15</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Trallĭā-ni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tralles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Trallians</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 22, 52 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48723" type="main" key="Tralles2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tralles</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:39" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 39</bibl> and 40.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tralli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
traloquor: <entryFree id="n48724" type="hapax" key="tra_lo^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trā-lŏquor</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-lŏquor</orth>, <itype>qui</itype>, <sense id="n48724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to talk over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recount</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impuritias alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
traluceo: <entryFree id="n48725" type="main" key="tra_lu_ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trālūcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, v. transluceo.</entryFree>
trama: <entryFree id="n48726" type="main" key="tra_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf.: trans, trāmes</etym>. <sense id="n48726.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the woof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weft</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">filling</hi> of a web (cf. subtemen), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=113" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 113</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 19, 22, 14 al.</bibl>—Of a spider's web: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa per se tenax ratio tramae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 81</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48726.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">figurae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a thin</tr>, <tr>lank figure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:73" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putridae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>trifles</tr>, <tr>bagatelles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trameo: <entryFree id="n48727" type="main" key="tra_me^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāmĕo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. transmeo.</entryFree>
trames: <entryFree id="n48728" type="main" key="tra_me^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāmĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>akin to trans, and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/rma,</foreign> goal</etym>. <sense id="n48728.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cross - way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sideway</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by-path</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foot-path</hi> (cf. semita): domum ire coepi tramite, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 62</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">egressus est non viis, sed tramitibus, paludatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Apennini tramitibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per tramites occulte perfugeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 57:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 57, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per tramites occultos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 48:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 48, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transvorsis tramitibus transgressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 39, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per devios tramites refugiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl> (4, 12), 44; 3 (4), 22, 24; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:515 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 515 al.</bibl> — </sense><sense id="n48728.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48728.2" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">path</hi>, <hi rend="ital">road</hi>, <hi rend="ital">course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cito decurrit tramite virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facili jam tramite sistam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 676</bibl></cit>: palantes error certo de tramite pellit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 84:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 84, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:48" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trames aquae immensae,</quote> <trans><tr>a channel</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 24, 41</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n48728.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Branches</hi> of a family, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:19:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 19, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48728.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a way of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">method</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner</hi>: (Epicurus) viam monstravit, tramite parvo Qua possemus<cb n="TRAN" />  ad id recto contendere cursu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aequitatis recto tramite deviare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augustissimus ad immortalitatis praemium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 18, 11 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
tramigro: <entryFree id="n48729" type="main" key="tra_mi_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāmī^gro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. transmigro.</entryFree>
tramitto: <entryFree id="n48730" type="main" key="tra_mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāmitto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. transmitto.</entryFree>
tranato: <entryFree id="n48731" type="main" key="tra_na^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trānăto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. transnato.</entryFree>
tranio: <entryFree id="n48732" type="main" key="Tra_nio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trānio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n48732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 17</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
trano: <entryFree id="n48733" type="main" key="tra_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trāno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">transno</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>trans-no</etym>, <sense id="n48733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swim over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swim through.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48733.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Tiberim desiluit et incolumis ad suos tranavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpauci viribus confisi tranare contenderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 48 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 29" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:18" default="NO">7, 5, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gangem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lethaeas per undas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 213</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsequio tranantur aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 181</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Eridanus tranandus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 258</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48733.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fly</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pierce through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permeate</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut parvum tranans geminaverit orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=403" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 403</bibl></cit> (650): <cit><quote lang="la">id cernemus toto genere hoc igneo, quod tranat omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 25</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: per auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:682" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 682</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:185" default="NO">13, 185</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">turbida nubila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina sublimi curru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:311" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentia spatia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:335" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 335</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus viri (hasta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:238" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:366" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 366</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tranquille: <entryFree id="n48734" type="main" key="tranquille_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tranquillē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tranquillus <sense id="n48734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tranquillitas: <entryFree id="n48735" type="main" key="tranquilli^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tranquillĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tranquillus</etym>, <sense id="n48735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quietness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stillness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquillity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48735.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">calmness</hi> of wind or weather, <hi rend="ital">a calm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta subito malacia ac tranquillitas exstitit, ut se ex loco movere non possent (naves),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si proficiscatur hac tranquillitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris tranquillitas intellegitur nullā ne minimā quidem aurā fluctus commovente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mira serenitas cum tranquillitate oriebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summā tranquillitate consecutā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidiosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:66:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 66, 3</bibl></cit>; and in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos longis navibus tranquillitates aucupaturi eramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">securitas quae est animi tamquam tranquillitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:8:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 8, 23</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48735.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">calmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serenity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquillity</hi> of mind or affairs (a favorite trope of Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">locus quietis et tranquillitatis plenissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillitas (animi), id est placida quietaque constantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa tranquillitas pacis et otii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 8, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 2:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 2, 3 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillitas animi et securitas ... tranquillitatem expetere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 20, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">otium ac tranquillitatem vitae sequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:27:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 27, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et jam ibi nequaquam eadem quies ac tranquillitas erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 27, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non multum ad tranquillitatem locus confert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 55:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 55, 8</bibl></cit>: illa tranquillitas vera est, in quam bona mens explicatur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 56:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 56, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillitatem et otium penitus auxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad carminis tranquillitatem tamquam ad portum confugerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48735.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48735.4" n="1" level="3"> De Tranquillitate Animi, <hi rend="ital">the title of a work of Seneca the philosopher.</hi> — </sense><sense id="n48735.5" n="2" level="3"> Tranquillitas tua, <hi rend="ital">Your Serenity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Your Serene Highness</hi>, a later title of the Roman emperors, Eutr. praef.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tranquillo: <entryFree id="n48736" type="main" key="tranquillo_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tranquillō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tranquillus, I. b. and II. b.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48737" type="main" key="tranquillo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tranquillo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tranquillus</etym>, <sense id="n48737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make calm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48737.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. sereno): mare tranquillatur oleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 234</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48737.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to clear up</tr>, <tr>brighten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48737.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquillize</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut aut perturbentur animi aut tranquillentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:26:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 26, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillatis rebus Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid pure tranquillet, honos an dulce lucellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tranquillus: <entryFree id="n48738" type="main" key="tranquillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tranquillus</orth>, a. um. <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n48738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquil</hi>, opp. to motion or excitement (syn. serenus). </sense><sense id="n48738.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, chiefly of calmness of weather: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mare, quod suā naturā tranquillum sit, ventorum vi agitari atque turbari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:49:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 49, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillo mari gubernare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 17</bibl>. 12: <cit><quote lang="la">leni ac tranquillo mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:609" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 609</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7</bibl></cit>, <cb n="TRAN" /> 8: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <trans><tr>calm</tr>, <tr>tranquil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 79, 81, § 192</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 45, 44, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serenitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:62:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 62, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic tranquillum mare dicitur, cum leviter movetur neque in unam partem inclinatur ... scito illud non stare, sed succuti leviter et dici tranquillum, quia neque huc neque illo impetum faciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48738.2" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tranquillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a calm; a quiet sea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillum est, Alcedonia sunt circum forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui te ad scopulum e tranquillo auferat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tranquillo tempestatem adversam optare dementis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita aut tranquillum aut procellae in vobis sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillo pervectus Chalcidem,</quote> <trans><tr>on the calm</tr>, <tr>tranquil sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 23, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classicique milites tranquillo in altum evecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 51, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tranquillo navigamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 8, 13</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillo, ut aiunt, quilibet gubernator est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:30" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia tranquillo velut oscitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 7, 6, § 18</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudines eminente dorso per tranquilla fluitantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 10, 12, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immoti jacent tranquilla pelagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 200" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48738.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquilla et serena frons,</quote> <trans><tr>calm</tr>, <tr>not disturbed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillo serenoque vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48738.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">peaceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">placid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">untroubled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undisturbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquil</hi> (cf. quietus): <cit><quote lang="la">efficiendum est, ut appetitus sint tranquilli atque omni perturbatione animi careant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillum facere ex irato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 3, 21</bibl></cit>; so (opp. irata) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 145</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut liqueant omnia et tranquilla sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillam concinna viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placata, tranquilla, quieta, beata vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pacatae tranquillaeque civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil quieti videre, nihil tranquilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutae tranquillaeque res omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillo animo esse potest nemo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 20, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillo pectore vultuque sereno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otia sine armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 171</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita hanc canem faciam tibi oleo tranquilliorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquilliorem plebem fecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:63:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 63, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse tranquillior animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of an orator: <cit><quote lang="la">in transferendis faciendisque verbis tranquillior (Isocrates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:52:176" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 52, 176</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud meum turbulentissimum tempus profectionis tuo tranquillissimo praestat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera videntur esse tranquilla: tranquillissimus autem animus meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillissima res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 25, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48738.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tranquillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">calmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquillity</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam ... in tam tranquillo ... locare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in tranquillo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5</bibl></cit> (8), 9, 8: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbe ex tranquillo nec opinata moles discordiarum ... exorta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 43, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem in tranquillum conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">republicā in tranquillum redactā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 40, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquilla tuens nec fronte timendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:38" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 38</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms. </sense><sense id="n48738.6" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tranquillē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">calmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quietly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquilly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclamare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquille placideque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:11:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere, with leniter, definite, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 28, 99</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillius manere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillissime senuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n48738.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tranquillō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">quietly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without disturbance</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nec cetera modo tribuni tranquillo peregere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 14, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. supra, I. b.—</sense><sense id="n48738.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">tranquillizing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bringing peaceful news</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillae tuae quidem litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
trans: <entryFree id="n48739" type="main" key="trans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans</orth>, <pos>prep.</pos> with <case>acc.</case> [Sanscr. tar-, to put across; tiram, brink; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/rma,</foreign> goal; Lat. terminus, etc.], <sense id="n48739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the farther side of.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48739.1" n="A" level="2"> With verbs of motion: <cit><quote lang="la">trans mare hinc venum asportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui trans mare currunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum multitudinem trans Rhenum in Galliam transducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexillum trans vallum hostium traicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trans vallum transicere signum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cineres transque caput jace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trans Apenninum coloniis missis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curvos trans ripam miserat arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Naevus trans Alpes usque transfertur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3, 12</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48739.2" n="B" level="2"> With verbs of rest: Germani trans Rhenum incolunt,<pb n="1888" /> <cb n="TRAN" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trans Tiberim hortos aliquos parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si scisset, sibi trans Euphratem esse pereundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domino trans ripam inspectante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo ipso tempore trans mare fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:29:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 29, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trans flumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuae res gestae ita notae sunt, ut trans montem Taurum etiam de Matrinio sit auditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia, quae trans Padum omnia loca tenuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus ultra castra transque montis exploratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:43:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 43, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48739.3" n="II" level="1"> In composition, trans before vowels, except <hi rend="ital">i</hi>, and the consonants <hi rend="ital">b</hi>, <hi rend="ital">c</hi>, <hi rend="ital">f</hi>, <hi rend="ital">g</hi>, <hi rend="ital">p</hi>, <hi rend="ital">r</hi>, <hi rend="ital">t</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">v</hi> remains unchanged; before <hi rend="ital">i</hi>, <hi rend="ital">j</hi>, <hi rend="ital">d</hi>, <hi rend="ital">l</hi>, <hi rend="ital">m</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">n</hi> the orthography varies between trans and trā, e. g. transdo and trado, transduco and traduco, etc.; the fuller form predominates in Cæsar. The <hi rend="ital">s</hi> of trans disappears usually before another <hi rend="ital">s</hi>, and always before <hi rend="ital">sc</hi>, e. g. transilio, transcendo, transpicio, etc.; cf. Bramb. Aids to Lat. Orth. p. 38; Neue, Formenl. II. 734 sq.—</sense><sense id="n48739.4" n="B" level="2"> As to its signification, trans denotes, </sense><sense id="n48739.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">across;</hi> as, trado, traduco, transcurro, transeo, etc.—</sense><sense id="n48739.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">through and through;</hi> as, transfigo, transigo, traicio, transadigo, etc.—</sense><sense id="n48739.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Beyond</hi>, transalpinus.</sense></entryFree>
transabeo: <entryFree id="n48740" type="main" key="transa^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-ăbĕo</orth>, <itype>ĭi, īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). <sense id="n48740.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go beyond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populos atque aequora longe Transabeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:510" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem fugā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:507" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">difficultate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 21</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transabiit non hunc sitiens gravis hasta cruorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:264" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 264</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48740.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go through.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48740.2" n="A" level="2"> Of a weapon, <hi rend="ital">to pierce through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfix</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis Transabiit costas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">costas (ensis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:9" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem (trabs),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 126</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48740.3" n="B" level="2"> Of a person: <cit><quote lang="la">per medias acies infesti militis transabivi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 191, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transactio: <entryFree id="n48741" type="main" key="transacti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transigo</etym> (postclass.). <sense id="n48741.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A completing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 55 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> Ep. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48741.1" n="II" level="1"> In jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">an agreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transaction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de transactionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2</bibl></cit>, tit. 15; 50, 16, 230.</sense></entryFree>
transactor: <entryFree id="n48742" type="hapax" key="transactor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transactor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a manager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transactor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum transactor et administer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:28:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 28, § 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transactus: <entryFree id="n48743" type="main" key="transactus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of transigo.</entryFree>
transadactus: <entryFree id="n48744" type="main" key="transa^dactus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transădactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of transadigo.</entryFree>
transadigo: <entryFree id="n48745" type="main" key="transa^di^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-ădĭgo</orth>, <itype>ēgi, actum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thrust through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pierce through</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. traicio): costas et crates pectoris ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 508</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gladium per medium pectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum sub papillam dexteram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 207: <cit><quote lang="la">horum unum ad medium ... Transadigit costas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 276</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:125" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem jaculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:141" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injecta lancea alterum per pectus medium transadegit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 234, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transalpibus: <entryFree id="n48746" type="hapax" key="Transalpi^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trans-alpĭbus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>Alpes</etym>, <sense id="n48746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from beyond the Alps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Transalpine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:30:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 30, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transalpinus: <entryFree id="n48747" type="main" key="Transalpi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trans-alpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n48747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lies beyond the Alps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Transalpine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:41:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 41, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognatio materna Transalpini sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 28</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Transalpīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">nations beyond the Alps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Transalpine nations</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio una ex Transalpinis conscripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transaustrinus: <entryFree id="n48748" type="hapax" key="transaustri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-austrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n48748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">southern</hi>, for austrinus: <cit><quote lang="la">halitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 608</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transbeneventanus: <entryFree id="n48749" type="main" key="Transbe^ne^venta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Transbĕnĕventānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>trans-Beneventum</etym>, <sense id="n48749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying beyond Beneventum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 27, 377</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transbibo: <entryFree id="n48750" type="main" key="transbi^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-bĭbo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drink down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drink up</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:7:105" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 7, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:4:8:128" default="NO">4, 8, 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transcendentia: <entryFree id="n48751" type="hapax" key="transcendenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transcendentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transcendo</etym>, <sense id="n48751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a transcending</hi>, Aggen. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:page=63" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> p. 63</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
transcendo: <entryFree id="n48752" type="main" key="transcendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transcendo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-scendo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>scando</etym>, <sense id="n48752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to climb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cross</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">step over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overstep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surmount.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48752.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (freq. and class.; cf.: supero, transgredior). </sense><sense id="n48752.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est periculum me ab asinis ad boves transcendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transcendere in hostium naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Italiam (Hasdrubal),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:42:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 42, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fines hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Latinum agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 53, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Sedetanum agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 31, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: per Vescinos<cb n="TRAN" />  in Campaniam Falernumque agrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 29, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 24, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48752.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: fossam transire et maceriam transcendere conantur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caucasum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 34, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 35, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apenninum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:8:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 14, 19</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n48752.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overstep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transcend</hi> (rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n48752.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad leviora,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass over</tr>, <tr>make a transition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad majora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:130:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 130, 3</bibl></cit>: ex minore aetate in majorem, Hyg. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:6:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 6, 15</bibl>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non abrupte cadere in narrationem, ita non obscure transcendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 79</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48752.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transcendere fines Juris,</quote> <trans><tr>to orerstep</tr>, <tr>transgress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transcendere ordinem aetatis, naturae, moris Macedonum, juris gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 11, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 9, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prohibita impune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec declinari transcendique posse agmina fati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7</bibl></cit> (6), 2, 5.—</sense><sense id="n48752.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To excel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transcend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem primae juventae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at tu transcendes, Germanice, facta tuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:607" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos factis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:428" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florentes annos viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:226" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota transcendi mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 912" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 912</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 702" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Troad. 702</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transcensus: <entryFree id="n48753" type="main" key="transcensus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transcensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of transcendo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48754" type="hapax" key="transcensus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transcensus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>transcendo</etym>, <sense id="n48754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a climbing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surmounting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scalarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">a crossing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 16, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48754.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a transition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad meliora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 119, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transcido: <entryFree id="n48755" type="hapax" key="transci_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transcīdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-scido</orth>), <itype>cīdi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>trans-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n48755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flog soundly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transcidi loris omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transcribo: <entryFree id="n48756" type="main" key="transcri_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transcrībo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-scrībo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to write over</hi> (from one book into another), <hi rend="ital">to transfer in writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to copy off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transcribe</hi> (syn. transfero). </sense><sense id="n48756.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">fabulas aut orationes totas vestrā manu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres ad verbum, Plin. H.
