N. praef. § 22: Cornelium Celsum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 2, 4</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">33: eundem librum in exemplaria transcriptum mille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba Quadrigarii ex Annali ejus sexto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:2:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48756.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48756.3" n="A" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to write off</hi> in an altered form, <hi rend="ital">to alter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tabulas (testamenti) prehendisset Oppianicus, digito legata delevit, et cum id multis locis fecisset, post mortem ejus, ne lituris coargui posset, testamentum in alias tabulas transcriptum signis adulterinis obsignavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui transcripserit tabulas publicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48756.4" n="B" level="2"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to make over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfer</hi> a thing to any one as his own; <hi rend="ital">to assign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convey</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in socios nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes alienum hereditarium in se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundos alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:5:12" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri plagam Publio et Gaio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:39" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 32, 1, 39 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48756.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to transfer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Turne, patiere tua Dardaniis transcribi sceptra colonis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cilicas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 461</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuiquam spatium vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 173</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48756.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To transfer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi> to another place or station: <cit><quote lang="la">turmas equitum ademptis equis in funditorum alas transcripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:15" default="NO">2, 7, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">transcribunt urbi matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 750</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48756.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum te in viros philosophia transcripserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quod malum transcribor!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Thyest. 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48756.8" n="D" level="2"> Of pictures, <hi rend="ital">to copy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfer</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exprimo, assimulo): multum degenerat transcribentium sors varia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 4, § 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transcripticius: <entryFree id="n48757" type="main" key="transcripti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transcriptīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>transcribo, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n48757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a transfer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assignment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <trans><tr>assignment of debts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:section=128" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, § 128</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transcriptio: <entryFree id="n48758" type="main" key="transcripti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transcriptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a transfer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assignment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a personā in personam transcriptio fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:section=130" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, § 130</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48758.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the transfer of a fault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the putting of an offence upon another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">privati veneni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 13:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 13, 11</bibl></cit> (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
transcriptus: <entryFree id="n48759" type="main" key="transcriptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transcriptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of transcribo.</entryFree>
transcurro: <entryFree id="n48760" type="main" key="transcurro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-curro</orth>, <itype>curri or cŭcurri</itype> (the former, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:81:282" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 81, 282</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 34, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 40, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 6, 10</bibl>; <sense id="n48760.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">the latter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 26, 25, § 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 16</bibl>), <itype>cursum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48760.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To run over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="TRAN" /> <hi rend="ital">run</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sail</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48760.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> cito Transcurre curriculo ad nos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:43 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 43 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc ad forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 359</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter ora populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 26, 25, § 96</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">remos transcurrentes detergere,</quote> <trans><tr>in sailing by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud dubius, sine noxā transcursuros, si nemo se opponeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:33" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:615" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 615</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">captis propioribus castris in altera transcursum castra ab Romanis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 39, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arcem transcurso opus est tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48760.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sine delectu temere in dissimilem rem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 34, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tamen ad melius poterit transcurrere quondam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in prolem transcurrit gratia patrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 51</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 136</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipiti cursu a virtute descitum, ad vitia transcursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48760.4" n="2" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to pass by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elapse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patiar ergo aestatem inquietem transcurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tempus jam longum transcurreret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48760.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To run</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasten</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pass through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to traverse.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48760.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">per spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per geminum tempus (harundo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:414" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum transcucurrisset Campaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquas trunci partes (umor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(luna) radios solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hellespontum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot montium juga transcucurrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum (nimbus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9</bibl></cit>. 111.— In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">raptim transcursā primā porticu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 217</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. 1, p. 520, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48760.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48760.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: suum cursum, <hi rend="ital">to run through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hasten to the end of one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s career</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:81:282" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 81, 282</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n48760.9" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to run through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi> in speaking, <hi rend="ital">to treat cursorily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch briefly upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:89" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā (narratione) sciens transcurram subtiles nimium divisiones,</quote> <trans><tr>pass over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:19" default="NO">10, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:8" default="NO">10, 5, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transcursim: <entryFree id="n48761" type="main" key="transcursim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transcursim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>transcurro</etym>, <sense id="n48761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cursorily</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Chrysol. Serm. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transcursio: <entryFree id="n48762" type="main" key="transcursi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transcursĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a passing over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lapse</hi> of a period of time (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">decennii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 23, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n48762.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hasty treatment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brief handling</hi> in thought: <cit><quote lang="la">non perfunctoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl></cit>, Serm, 13, 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
transcursorius: <entryFree id="n48763" type="main" key="transcurso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transcursōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cursory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superficial</hi> (late Lat.): neque id breve aut transcursorium fuit, Jul. Val. Rer. Gest, Alex. 3, 36.</sense></entryFree>
transcursus: <entryFree id="n48764" type="main" key="transcursus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transcursus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of transcurro.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n48765" type="main" key="transcursus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transcursus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>transcurro</etym> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n48765.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a running</hi>, <hi rend="ital">darting</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">flying through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulguris,</quote> <trans><tr>a flash of lightning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:90" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avibus maximis minimisque per aëra transcursus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48765.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">a running through</hi> or <hi rend="ital">over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a brief touching upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cursory mention</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto omnia transcursu dicenda sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:55:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 55, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud etiam in hoc transcursu dicendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:99:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 99, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc transcursu tam artati operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:86:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 86, 1</bibl></cit>; so, in transcursu, <hi rend="ital">cursorily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by the way</hi> (cf. obiter), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:126" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 13, 34, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:154" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 8, 44, § 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 57:16" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 57, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transdanubianus: <entryFree id="n48766" type="main" key="Transda_nu^bi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Trans-dānŭbĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-dānŭvĭā-nus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Danubius</etym>, <sense id="n48766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">situated beyond the Danube</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Transdanubian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dacia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 39, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:58:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 58, 8</bibl></cit> (dub.; al. Aquiloniam regionem).—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Transdānŭbĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the nations beyond the Danube</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 750</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transditus: <entryFree id="n48767" type="main" key="transdi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transdĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of transdo; v. trado.</entryFree>
transdo: <entryFree id="n48768" type="main" key="transdo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transdo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. trado.</entryFree>
transduco: <entryFree id="n48769" type="main" key="transdu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transdūco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, and its derivatives; v. traduco, etc.</entryFree>
transenna: <entryFree id="n48770" type="main" key="transenna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transenna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trāsenna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (orig. perh. plaited work; hence), <sense id="n48770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a noose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">springe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">net.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48770.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ab transennā hic turdus lumbricum petit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: in transennā demissum Vietoriae simulacrum, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 180</bibl>. 21, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl> (Hist. 2, 23, 3); so <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 11, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25, 6, 14</bibl>; cf.: transenna <foreign lang="greek">bro/xos e)n a)fethri/ais tetame/nos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.—</sense><sense id="n48770.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A netting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lattice-work</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cancelli, fenestra): quasi per transennam praetereuntes strictim aspeximus,</quote> <trans><tr>as if through a lattice</tr>, <tr>while passing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 162</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48770.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a snare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trap</hi> (Plautinian): hunc ego hominem hodie in transennam doctis <pb n="1889" /> <cb n="TRAN" /> ducam dolis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:10 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 10 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
transeo: <entryFree id="n48771" type="main" key="transe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-ĕo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ĭtum, īre</itype> (<sense id="n48771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> -ivit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 13, 3</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> -iet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:27" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:10:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 18, 3</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to go over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">across</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cross over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi> (syn. transgredior). </sense><sense id="n48771.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48771.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n48771.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego ad vos eum jussero transire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per hortum ad amicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad uxorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 3, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 5, 7</bibl>: ad te, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7</bibl></cit> (8), 28: <cit><quote lang="la">ne Germani e suis finibus in Helvetiorum fines transirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in agrum Noricum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Britanniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per eorum corpora transire conantes repulerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per media castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 107:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 107, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per illud (iter, i. e. vocis) Murmure blanditiae minimo transire solebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 70</bibl></cit>: obsides ut inter sese dent, perficit; <cit><quote lang="la">Helvetii, ut sine maleficio et injuriā transeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 46, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mosa in Rhenum transit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseum per cribrum facito transeat in mortarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 76, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor foliorum transit in vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 3, 7, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus ad nos ex aliis transire gentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 69</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48771.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campos pedibus transire videmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taurus transiri non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apenninum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 33, 4</bibl> sq.; 21, 38, 6; 26, 12, 14; <cit><quote lang="la">21, 58, 3: paulatim Germanos consuescere Rhenum transire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 13: Euphratem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:42:146" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 42, 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:24:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 24, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 345</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paludem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:10" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum cursu,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 719</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes mensas transiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (serpentem) rota transiit,</quote> <trans><tr>ran over</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulis medios articulos (digitorum) non transeuntibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:142" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Domitii filius transiit Formias,</quote> <trans><tr>passed through Formiæ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodanus nonnullis locis vado transitur,</quote> <trans><tr>is crossed by a ford</tr>, <tr>is fordable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen uno omnino loco pedibus transiri potest,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 18</bibl></cit>; 2, 10; 7, 55; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:27" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 27, § 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totus transibitur orbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 398</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48771.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48771.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go over</hi> to a party or side (cf. transfugio): <cit><quote lang="la">ne deserat me atque ad hostes transeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad adversarios transeas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:15:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 15, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Pompeium transierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transit cohors ad eum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Patribus ad plebem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum iis pugnare ad quos transierant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Q. Sextii philosophi sectam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 18</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec manere nec transire aperte ausus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nulla ante Britanniae nova pars illacessita transierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48771.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass over</hi> into any thing by transformation, <hi rend="ital">to be changed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">transformed</hi> into a thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ille in humum saxumque undamque trabemque fallaciter transit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 643</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in plures figuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:730" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 730</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humana in corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:167" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aestatem post ver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:206" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua mulsa longā vetustate transit in vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 52, § 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:139" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 41, 65, § 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:103" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 9, 57, § 103</bibl>; 37, 6, 23, § 87.—</sense><sense id="n48771.8" n="3" level="3"> Of food. <hi rend="ital">to pass through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi qui difficillime transeant sumpti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 79, § 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum tenue per urinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 22, § 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48771.9" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfix</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ilia cornipedis surrectā cuspide transit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:253" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 253</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48771.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48771.11" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n48771.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quod quaedam animalis intellegentia per omnia ea permanet et transeat,</quote> <trans><tr>runs through</tr>, <tr>pervades</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam ista saevitia inter peregrina exempla mansisset, nec in Romanos mores transisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:18:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (ordinis) similitudine perspectā in formarum specie ac dignitate transitum est et ad honestatem dictorum atque factorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 47</bibl></cit>.— More freq., </sense><sense id="n48771.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ii sine dubio finem et modum transeunt,</quote> <trans><tr>go beyond</tr>, <tr>overstep</tr>, <tr>transgress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 102</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finem aequitatis et legis in judicando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:95:section=220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 95, § 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines verecundiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid silentio,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass over</tr>, <tr>pass by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:23" default="NO">5, 12, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">nil transit amantes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>escapes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:335" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 335</bibl></cit>; so, ita compositi sumus<cb n="TRAN" />  ut nos cottidiana, etiamsi admiratione digna sunt, transeant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48771.14" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48771.15" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pass over</hi> to another opinion: <cit><quote lang="la">in sententiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 34, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus frequens in alia omnia transiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:53" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 53</bibl></cit>: transierunt illuc, ut ratio esset ejus habenda, qui neque exercitum neque provincias traderet, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 13, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48771.16" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be changed</hi> into any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo quire et ruere vel in praeterita patiendi modo, vel in participia transibunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eam (vocalem sequentem) transire possit (M),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:29" default="NO">1, 4, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frequens imitatio transit in mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jactantur cuncta et in contrarium transeunt jubente fortunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 99, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vinum transire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 52, § 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:84:6" default="NO">84, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:85:15" default="NO">85, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48771.17" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To overpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surpass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui hoc agit, ut prior sit, forsitan, etiamsi non transierit, aequabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum ut transeundi spes non sit, magna tamen est dignitas subsequendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium transire paras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumenta transibit nostra juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 499</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48771.18" n="4" level="3"> In speaking. </sense><sense id="n48771.19" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To pass over</hi> to another subject: <cit><quote lang="la">ad partitionem transeamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:21:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 21, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad alias (quaestiones),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc ad rationem sermonis conjuncti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">protinus ad dispositionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad responsum partis alterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad rhetoris officia (proximus liber),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 12, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consumptis precibus violentam transit in iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde in syllabas cura transibit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seminarii curam ante convenit dici, quam transeatur ad alia genera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 13, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transeatur ad alteram contionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:37:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 37, 11</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n48771.20" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To go quickly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">briefly through</hi> a subject (syn. transcurro): <cit><quote lang="la">sed in animo est leviter transire ac tantummodo perstringere unamquamque rem,</quote> <trans><tr>to touch lightly upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperare et ea quae premant et ea quae inpendeant me facile transiturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos (libros) omnes duabus proximis noctibus cursim transeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevi auditu quamvis magna transibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48771.21" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To pass over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave untouched</hi> (so freq. first in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. praetermitto): malueram, quod erat susceptum ab illis, silentio transiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: ex quo tu quae digna sunt, selige, multa transi, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 11, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut alii transeunt quaedam imputantque quod transeant: sic ego nihil praetereo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neronem enim transeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Protagoran transeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:22" default="NO">12, 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:22" default="NO">12, 10, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed hoc transeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne id quidem transeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transeamus id quoque, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut transeam, quemadmodum vulgo imperiti loquantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5 praef" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5 praef.</bibl></cit>—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec a nobis neglegenter locus iste transibitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa quoque minora non sunt transeunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:3" default="NO">10, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">levia haec et transeunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transita signa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 486</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48771.22" n="5" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to pass by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elapse.</hi> </sense><sense id="n48771.23" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum legis dies transierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies hibernorum complures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi jam menses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinquennium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:37" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: tran et aetas; <cit><quote lang="la">Quam cito!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:27" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">menses transeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 11</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n48771.24" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne vitam silentio transeant,</quote> <trans><tr>pass through</tr>, <tr>spend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8</bibl></cit> Kritz <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum tribunatūs annum quiete et otio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemem (securi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium juventae,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass beyond</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 226</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48771.25" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">precarium seni imperium et brevi transiturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna imperii transit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutatam auctoritatem (unguenti) et saepius transisse gloriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid irarum fuit, transierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 398" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum et terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 5, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl> Pet. 3, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,023:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Joan. 2, 17</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">transĕunter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (acc. to transeo, II. B. 4. b.), <hi rend="ital">in passing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cursorily</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">commemorata quaestio, Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 23: discussā indiciorum fide,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transero: <entryFree id="n48772" type="main" key="transe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transĕro</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-sĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n48772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>sertum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> * </sense><sense id="n48772.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To pass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thrust through</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per aliquid ramulum transerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 133, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48772.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To transfer by grafting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ingraft</hi>: vidi ego transertos alieno <cb n="TRAN" /> in robore ramos Altius ire suis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:101" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transertus: <entryFree id="n48773" type="main" key="transertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of transero.</entryFree>
transeunter: <entryFree id="n48774" type="main" key="transe^unter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transĕunter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. transeo <sense id="n48774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
transfero: <entryFree id="n48775" type="main" key="transfe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-fĕro</orth>, <itype>tŭli, lātum</itype> (also written trālātum), <itype>ferre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear across; to carry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring over; to convey over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transport</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfer</hi> (syn.: traduco, traicio). </sense><sense id="n48775.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48775.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cadum modo hinc a me huc cum vino transferam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc (simulacrum Dianae) translatum Carthaginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:33:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 33, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustela catulos suos cottidie transfert mutatque sedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 16, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar paulo ultra eum locum castra transtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra trans Peneum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:60:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 60, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra Baetim, Auct. B. Alex. 60, 5: signa ex statione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad se ornamenta ex his (hortis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias in Boeotiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of personal objects: illinc huc transferetur virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Naevius trans Alpes usque transfertur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hoc hominum numero in impiorum partem atque in parricidarum coetum ac numerum transferetis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o Venus ... vocantis Ture te multo Glycerae decoram Transfer in aedem,</quote> <trans><tr>transport thyself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 30, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48775.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48775.4" n="1" level="3"> Botanical t. t., of plants, <hi rend="ital">to transplant; to transfer by grafting</hi> (syn. transero): <cit><quote lang="la">semina, quae transferuntur e terrā in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:39:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 39, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:40:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:20:2" default="NO">20, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">videndum quā ex arbore in quam transferatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:41:1" default="NO">1, 41, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia translata meliora grandioraque fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 12, 60, § 183</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n48775.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To transfer by writing</hi> from one book into another; <hi rend="ital">to copy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transcribe</hi> (syn. transcribo): <cit><quote lang="la">litterae ... de tabulis in libros transferuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77:section=189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77, § 189</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">rationes in tabulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tuo edicto in meum totidem verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus translati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48775.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To carry along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry in public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear in triumph</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">triduum triumphavit. Die primo arma tela signaque aerea et marmorea transtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:52:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 52, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo triumpho XLIX. coronae aureae translatae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 58, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantundem auri atque argenti in eo triumpho translatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 42, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transtulit in triumpho multa militaria signa spoliaque alia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 43, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in triumpho Caesaris eborea oppida essent translata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48775.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n48775.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to convey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transport</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Celtiberiam bellum transferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum videat omne ad se bellum translatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilium Lutetiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina in Britannia reperta atque inde in Galliam translata esse existimatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed, si placet, sermonem alio transferamus,</quote> <trans><tr>turn</tr>, <tr>direct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:29:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 29, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">translatos alio maerebis amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:23" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem huc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem In mares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similitudinem ab oculis ad animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ad accusandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:22:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 22, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ab Ennio positum in unā re transferri in multas potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">definitionem in aliam rem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc idem transfero in magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:51:section=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 51, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est enim, quod de suo genere in aliud genus transferri possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam in alios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">transferendi in nos criminis causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 38, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suscepere duo manipulares imperium populi Romani transferendum et transtulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: invidiam criminis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to avert from one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque obvius, quamvis leviter audita in alios transferunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in jus Latii nationes Alpium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad se Lacedaemonii arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1:8" default="NO">38, 1, 8</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s attention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devote one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad artes componendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:12:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 12, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad album et rubricas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 19</bibl></cit>.—In eccl. Lat., <hi rend="ital">to remove from the world without death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">translatus in paradisum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 44, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heb. 11, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48775.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n48775.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To put off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">postpone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defer</hi>, in respect of time (syn.: differo, prolato): causa haec integra in proximum annum transferetur, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subito reliquit annum suum seseque in proximum annum transtulit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>postponed his suit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 9, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48775.11" n="2" level="3"> Of speaking or writing. </sense><sense id="n48775.12" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To</hi> <pb n="1890" /> <cb n="TRAN" /> <hi rend="ital">translate</hi> into another language (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verto, reddo, interpretor, exprimo): istum ego locum totidem verbis a Dicaearcho transtuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad eorum cognitionem divina illa ingenia transferrem ... locos quidem quosdam transferam, et maxime ab iis quos modo nominavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">analogia, quam proxime ex Graeco transferentes in Latinum proportionem vocaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui haec ex Graeco transtulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volumina in linguam Latinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 5, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod Cicero his verbis transfert, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">kat) a)nti/lhy/in</foreign> Latine ad verbum translatum non invenio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:7" default="NO">7, 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul quae legentem fefellissent, transferentem fugere non possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48775.13" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To transfer</hi> to a secondary or figurative signification, <hi rend="ital">to use figuratively</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tropically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utemur verbis aut iis, quae propria sunt ... aut iis, quae transferuntur et quasi alieno in loco collocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:37:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 37, 149</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:5 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 5 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:4" default="NO">9, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum verbum aliquod altius transfertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 25, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">translata verba atque immutata. Translata dico, ut saepe jam, quae per similitudinem ab aliā re aut suavitatis aut inopiae causā transferuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intexunt fabulas, verba apertius transferunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48775.14" n="c" level="4"> Rhet. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">translatum exordium est, quod aliud conficit, quam causae genus postulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:18:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 18, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 71</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48775.15" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To apply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make use of</hi> (for a new purpose, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc animi vitium ad utilitatem non transferemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inde stellionum nomine in male translato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 10, 27, § 89</bibl></cit> Jan. (al. in maledictum; cf. 2. b. supra).—</sense><sense id="n48775.16" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transform</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia In species translata novas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas verterat se transtuleratque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ebur et robur in o litteram secundae syllabae transferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transfigo: <entryFree id="n48776" type="main" key="transfi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-fīgo</orth>, <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n48776.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To thrust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pierce through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to transpierce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfix</hi> a thing or a person (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. traicio): sagittā Cupido cor meum transfixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evelli jussit eam, quā erat transfixus, hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:30:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 30, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transfixi pilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Fabium gladio per pectus transfigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 46, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stricto gladio simul verbis increpans transfigit puellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrario ictu per parmam transfixus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 36, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transfigitur scutum Pulfioni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scuta uno ictu pilorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguibus anguem, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 47, 106: transfixo pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 44</bibl></cit>.—In a Greek construction: <cit><quote lang="la">qui hastis corpus transfigi solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sonipes transfixus pectora ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 528</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48776.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To thrust</hi> something <hi rend="ital">through</hi> a thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">latos huic hasta per armos Acta tremit duplicatque virum transfixa dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora ducis transfixo deformia pilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 138</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transfigurabilis: <entryFree id="n48777" type="main" key="transfi^gu_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transfĭgūrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>trans-figuro</etym>, <sense id="n48777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">transformable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfigurable</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">angeli in carnem humanam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
transfiguratio: <entryFree id="n48778" type="main" key="transfi^gu_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transfĭgūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a change of shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transformation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfiguration</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 55, 56, § 188</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">transfiguratio interemptio est pristini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transfigurator: <entryFree id="n48779" type="hapax" key="transfi^gu_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transfĭgūrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a transformer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfigurer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 2</bibl></cit> (from 2 Cor. 11, 13, where the Vulg. has transfigurantes se).</sense></entryFree>
transfiguro: <entryFree id="n48780" type="main" key="transfi^gu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-fĭgūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to change in shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to transform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfigure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">metamorphose</hi> (post-Aug.; cf.: verto, muto). </sense><sense id="n48780.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum in muliebrem naturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in simiae speciem transfiguratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lupum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 22, 34, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scorpiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pumicem (al. mutantur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 25, 50, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et qui corpora prima transfigurat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ovid in the Metamorphoses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:78" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amygdalae ex dulcibus transfigurantur in amaras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aede Castoris et Pollucis in vestibulum transfigurata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 9, 1</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>: Satanas transfigurat se in angelum lucis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 11, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48780.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to change</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transform</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum animos in eum quem volumus habitum formare et velut transfigurare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: intellego, <cb n="TRAN" /> non emendari me tantum, sed transfigurari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 6:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 6, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48780.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n48780.4" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assume to be</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretend to be</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transfigurantes se in apostolos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 11, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n48780.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To express under a figure of speech</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec transfiguravi in me et Apollo propter vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transfixus: <entryFree id="n48781" type="main" key="transfixus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transfixus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of transfigo.</entryFree>
transfluo: <entryFree id="n48782" type="main" key="transflu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-flŭo</orth>, <itype>xi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n48782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to flow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">run through</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare). </sense><sense id="n48782.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <trans><tr>runs out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 38, 91, § 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <trans><tr>soaks through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 35, 63, § 155</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n48782.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of time, <hi rend="ital">to pass away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elapse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Ep. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transfluvialis: <entryFree id="n48783" type="main" key="transflu^vi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transflŭvĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n48783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">born</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coming from beyond the river</hi> (transl. of Heb. <foreign />; eccl. Lat.), S. S. Gen. 14, 13, Vers. Antiq. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Locut. in Heptat. 1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Locut. in Heptat. 1</bibl> ad l. l.</sense></entryFree>
transfodio: <entryFree id="n48784" type="main" key="transfo^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-fŏdĭo</orth>, <itype>fōdi, fossum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to thrust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">run through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stab through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transfix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transpierce</hi> (class., but not in Cic.): Galli in scrobes delapsi transfodiebantur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde fugienti latus transfodisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:42:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 42, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transfosso oculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochlea acu transfossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 4, 11, § 31</bibl></cit>.—In a Greek construction: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora duro Transfossi ligno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 544</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transforatio: <entryFree id="n48785" type="main" key="transfo^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transfŏrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transforo</etym>, <sense id="n48785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boring through</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
transformatio: <entryFree id="n48786" type="main" key="transforma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transformātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>transformo</etym>, <sense id="n48786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a change of shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transformation</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">optabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 15:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 15, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
transformis: <entryFree id="n48787" type="main" key="transformis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">transformis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n48787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">changed in shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transformed</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">(Proteus) transformis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:373" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:871" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 871</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
transformo: <entryFree id="n48788" type="main" key="transformo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">trans-formo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n48788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to change in shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transform</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; syn. verto). </sense><sense id="n48788.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Proteus) Omnia transformat sese in miracula rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 441</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vultus sese aniles (Alecto),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra in juvencos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta In segetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:654" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 654</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmas novem in ignes (i. e. stellas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:515" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Scylla) in scopulum Transformata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 3, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n48788.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc (animum) transformari quodammodo ad naturam eorum, de quibus loquimur, necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
